loans.name: Kroeurn

texts.en:
Kroeurn lives in a rural village of Battambang province, is 37-year-old, and is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school.

Growing cassava has been their main source of income for ten years and she can earn income via working for a labor fee to support her living. She lacks working capital to grow cassava so she cannot earn a good income.

She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she repaid her previous loan completely. The past loan helped her to improve her family’s living better than before.

She is now applying for a loan in order to buy seed and pesticide and pay for labor fees to produce a good yield. She hopes to sell her crop product for a good profit so that she can upgrade her living standards and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seed to produce a good yield in order to gain a good profit so that she can keep sending her children to school.

loans.name: Madai Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Madai Gabina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia es una persona trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Madai Gabina continues with her business selling dry grains such as corn, wheat, and quinoa.  She is a hardworking person, and through the means of this business, she strives to get ahead.  The member is requesting this loan to purchase corn, barley, and wheat. She is happy to receive the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase corn, barley, and wheat.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita has been effectively working with her vegetable garden for 30 years. Even after her husband died, she continued working for profit. She resumed planting vegetables in order to sell them in the market. For 30 years working with her garden, she earned a lot and was able to pay her previous loan. She took a new loan again to purchase fertilizer for her garden so that she can produce good quality vegetables for her customers that will generate more income.

Florita's plan for the future is to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Chicken Band - N04Dhy2Đhưng Group

texts.en:
Ngân is 40 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Ngân lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is unstable because when some diseases happen to poultry, they could die so she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance.

The main hardship that Ngân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Ngân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of Chicken Band - N04DHy2ĐHưng, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Comemoracion

texts.en:
Comemoracion, 67, is married, has six children and lives in the Philippines. For the past five years she has sold flowers to earn an income.

Comemoracion has applied for a 4000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy different kinds of flowers such as orchids and roses to sell to her customers. She is saving money to build up her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of flowers such as orchids and roses to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 48, is married and has seven children, one of whom is in school. She must work very hard to provide for them.

For the past three years Jane has run a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She has applied for a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell. She is saving money to help provide for a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Geraldine is 22 years old and one of her children is in school.

Geraldine has a buy and sell of frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy frozen products to sell in her business.

Geraldine has been in this business for two years. In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen products to sell in her business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is operating his transportation business. He has been doing this for more than twenty years, and he earns well from this activity.

Recently, Ruben took a new loan from GDMPC to repaint his motorcycle and buy tires in order to replace his old, used tires. Ruben finds ways to save more money to improve the future general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new tires and repaint his motorcycle

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 42 years old, married and living with her five children. To help her husband, who does the fishing, Ermelinda is the one who does fish selling to earn for a living.

She has been determined in sustaining their business. She wants to increase their income to improve their living conditions.

She gained access to GDMPC, and she recently took a loan to cover the maintenance of her pump boat in order to produce a variety of fish to sell in the market.

In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance of her pump boat.

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
Mariefe has been operating her transportation business for nine years. With the help of her husband who does the driving, it has been earning a lot and she was able to repay her previous loan. She wants to earn more so now she took a new loan to buy new tires and brake pads to provide good service to her customers and sent them to their designated area safely.

Mariefe may realize a profitable business and improve the quality of their lives as well as the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy new tires and brake pads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Barbara Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Barbara Hilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,mantequilla,galletas y fideos,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio de tienda de abarrotes la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azúcar,mantequillas,fideos y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member, Barbara Hilda, continues with her grocery store and restaurant business.  She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, butter, cookies, and noodles, and works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  Through means of this grocery store business, she gets her children ahead.  Barbara Hilda wishes to expand and improve her grocery store business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase products to stock her grocery store such as rice, sugar, butter, noodles, and cookies.  She is happy to be receiving the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her grocery store such as rice, sugar, butter, noodles, and cookies. .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de sorbetes artesanales desde hace 40 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y ya tiene muchos clientes pues su producto es de muy buena calidad, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de los insumos para la elaboración como: leche, coco, azúcar, fresas, vainilla, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Ismael, 63, lives in his own home with his wife.  For forty years, he has been engaged in making and selling artisanal sorbets.  He works as a street vendor throughout the various communities, and has many customers as his product is of very good quality.  He is requesting another loan to purchase ingredients such as milk, coco, sugar, strawberries, and vanilla, and thus have better income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as milk, coco, sugar, strawberries, and vanilla.

loans.name: Keburana Group

texts.fr:
Annociate  fait partie du groupe  Keburana et  habite à  Gitega. C’est une célibataire de  28 ans. Elle a 4 enfants dont 2 étudient. 
 

Elle fait le commerce du  riz, du haricot,...dans sa boutique  depuis  10 ans. 


Elle est à son cinquième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Annociate belongs to group Keburana and lives in Gitega. She is 28 years old and single. She has four children, two of whom go to school.
 

She has retailed rice and beans from her store for ten years.


This is her fifth loan with Turame. With the loan granted by kiva, she will increase her capital and purchase large quantities of rice and beans to retail and earn more.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy large quantities of rice and beans to retail and earn more.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a 24-year-old woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ronalyn has had a gravel and sand business in the Philippines for eight years. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more gravel and sand to sell.

Ronalyn's goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gravel and sand to sell

loans.name: Jamil Alexander

texts.es:
Jamil es un joven estudiante de Senati. Eligió estudiar la carrera de Mantenimiento de Maquinaria Pesada para la construcción porque le gusta mucho la mecánica y le fascina las grandes máquinas. Actualmente lleva estudiando un año y medio de su carrera, aún le falta otro año y medio para que la culmine. Cuando eso suceda, siente que lo beneficiará mucho como persona y a su familia, porque le permitirá apoyarlos económicamente; así como ellos lo hicieron durante el tiempo de su carrera.

En el ámbito estudiantil todo le va muy bien, le dedica 9 horas diarias a sus estudios. El único obstáculo que se le presenta es el económico, lo que pone en riesgo la continuidad de su carrera. Sus padres no cuentan con recursos para continuar apoyándolo en su carrera porque es una de las más costosas hoy en día.

Es por ese motivo que está solicitando el apoyo de KIVA para continuar con sus estudios, sueña con convertirse con un excelente profesional, capacitarse constantemente y poder trabajar fuera del país o de lo contrario en una importante empresa minera. Este préstamo obtenido le permitirá cancelar todas sus mensualidades y así terminar su carrera en el tiempo estimado para que pueda apoyar a su familia que tanto lo necesita.

Él se siente muy feliz al recibir este gran apoyo; por eso quiere dedicarle unas palabras:"Les diría, muchísimas gracias por ayudarme a concluir con mis estudios".
texts.en:
Jamil is a young Senati student. He decided to study Heavy Machinery Maintenance for construction because he likes mechanics and he is fascinated by large machinery. He has been studying for a year and a half and has another year and a half to go before he finishes. When that happens he feels that it will be a great personal benefit as well as a benefit to his family because he will be able to support them financially, just as they did for him during his studies.

Jamil dedicates nine hours every day to his studies which are going very well. The only obstacle is a financial one which is putting his ability to continue with his program at risk. His parents do not have the resources to continue supporting him because it is currently one of the most expensive programs. This is why he is asking for KIVA's support so he can continue with his studies. He dreams of becoming an excellent professional, staying current with his training, and to be able to work outside of the country or else for a major mining company. If he gets this loan, he will be able to pay his monthly fees and finish his program in the estimated time frame and begin providing his family the support they need so much.

He is very happy to have this tremendous support and wants to say a few words: "I would say, thank you so much for helping me to complete my studies."

loans.use: to pay for his studies in Heavy Machinery Maintenance, become an excellent professional and work for a major mining company.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
A senhora Carolina de 30 anos de idade é comerciante, vive maritalmente a 14 anos tem como frutos desta relação tem 04 filhos 3 dos quais no ensino primário 1 ainda menor e é comerciante e vive na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar blocos, cimento, janelas,  e chapas de zinco para a sua barraca ainda em construção.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, fazer dependências para arrendar reforçando assim a renda familiar  e oficializar sua relação, casando oficialmente.
Tem como desafios financeiros e para ultrapassa-los conta com ajuda do seu esposo que trabalha numa quinta na zona onde vive, com os empréstimos anteriores adquiriu vários bens e fez a sua casa e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
30-year-old Carolina is a businesswoman. She has been living in a common-law marriage for fourteen years, and from this relationship she has four children; three of them go to primary school and one is still very young. She owns the house where she lives.

She says she will use this loan to buy bricks, cement, windows, and zinc sheets for her house, which is still under construction.

She dreams of finishing building her house and build some rooms to rent in order to strengthen the family’s income and formalize her marriage.

Her challenges are financial in nature, and her husband, who works in a plot of land close to where they live, helps her to overcome them. With the previous loans, she purchased some goods and started to build her house. She is planning to apply for more loans to fulfill her needs and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, windows, and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria tiene 66 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 8 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maria, 66, lives in her own home with her family.  For eight years, she has owned a small general store, located in her home. She has many customers because of her good prices, and kindness when making sales.  She is requesting another loan to purchase soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, and other items.  In this way, she will have better income.

loans.use: to purchase soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, and other items.

loans.name: Asela

texts.en:
Asela is 31 years old and has two children. She is single and one of her children is in school.

Asela is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Asela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Asela has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Asela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luz is 53 years old and three of her children are in school.

Luz has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Luz has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Luz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Barnyard - N01Đtìnhyđinh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dốn is 45 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for more than 10 years. Dốn lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Her business is hard and the capital turnover is very long. So it is very difficult for her to cover her living expenses and save money.

The main hardship that Dốn faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. This is Dốn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan can improve her living standard.

Dốn is the group leader of Barnyard - N01ĐTìnhYĐinh, which consists of three members. With her business profit, Dốn hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Oumou's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré le 12 Juillet 2007 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont une bonne maîtrise du programme. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe.
 
Madame Oumou, âgée de 49 ans (assise à l’extrême gauche et levant la main), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide et Lalo « feuille de baobab servant à la préparation de couscous » qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaire pour le revendre en détails.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de 50 kg Lalo à 20000f C FA, 02 sacs d’arachide à 15000f l’un pour le revendre en détails

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Inaugurated on 12 July 2007, this banc villageois is made up of women from the village who are experienced in the program. They work primarily in small-scale commerce and rain-fed agriculture. A positive ambiance permeates the group meetings.

Oumou, who is seated on the far left with her hand raised [in the photo], is 49 years old and the featured borrower of this group. She is married and the mother of seven children--of whom three are sons.

Oumou works selling groundnut paste and Lalo, which are baobab leaves used to make couscous. She buys these goods in the weekly markets and then resells them at retail.

With this new loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of Lalo for 20,000 francs CFA and two sacs of groundnuts for 15,000 francs per sac, which she will resell at retail.

With the earnings, she plans to support her husband with the daily expense and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy Lalo and groundnut paste to resell

loans.name: Faty's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de femmes fait partie du banc villageois depuis le 20 mars 2007. Ces femmes habitent le même village et ont comme principales activités le petit commerce et l'élevage. Madame Rouba l'emprunteur en vedette à droite sur la photo est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont 1 fille. Elle s'active dans le commerce de fruits et légumes. Elle espère investir tout son prêt (200000Fcfa) pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en légumes (02 sacs de carottes, choux, navets....) et fruits de saison (pastèque, mangues, oranges....) pour mieux développer son activité. Avec les bénéfices elle va renforcer son épargne et appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of women has been part of the 'banc villageois' since March 20, 2007. They live in the same village, and their main work involves small-scale commerce and livestock farming. Ms. Rouba, the featured borrower at the right in the photo, is 40 years old and a married mother of three children (a girl and two boys). She is active in the commerce of fruit & vegetables. 

Ms. Roubadieng hopes to invest all of her loan (200,000 francs CFA) to stock up on vegetables (2 sacks of carrots, cabbages, turnips, …) and seasonal fruit (watermelons, mangos, oranges, …) to develop her business further. With the profits, she is going to bolster her savings and support her husband in managing the family.

loans.use: to  purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Enyonam  Ablavi

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants  et âgée de 34 ans, Enyonam est femme mariée qui habite à Baguida. Enyonam prépare et  vend de l’igname frit à la devanture de sa maison. Enyonam s’approvisionne au marché quatre fois par mois. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour commander des ignames, des bidons d'huile et des macaronis en vue de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Enyonam, age 34, is married with three children and she lives in Baguida. She makes a fried yam dish that she sells in front of her house. She buys ingredients at the market four times per month. 

Enyonam is seeking this loan to purchase yams, oil and macaroni pasta. She hopes to bolster her income and help her husband with their household’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 1 gourdful of yams, two jugs of oil and four cartons of macaroni pasta.

loans.name: Merebara Group

texts.fr: La femme qui a le bélier dans la photo s’appelle Mariam. Elle a 34 ans et vit au mali avec son mari, ses 8 enfants et ses beaux-parents. Une fille et un garçon sont à l’école. Son mari fait l’embouche bovine. Elle achète des moutons au marché local, les élève et les revend dans son village. Depuis 10 ans  elle fait ce travail pour contribuer aux charges familiales. Mariam demande du prêt au RMCR dans le but d’acheter  des moutons pour son activité de l’élevage. Ce qui lui permettra de gagner un profit mensuel de 12 500 fcfa. L’intérêt  généré l’aidera de payer de la nourriture et de nouveaux habits pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The woman holding the sheep in the photo is named Mariam. She is 34 years old and lives in Mali with her husband, her eight children, and her in-laws. A daughter and a son are in school. Her husband is a livestock farmer of cows. Mariam buys sheep a the local market, raises them, and then resells them in her village. For ten years, she has been doing this work to help cover family expenses.

Mariam is asking for a loan from RMCR with the goal of purchasing sheep for her livestock business. It will enable her to earn a monthly profit of 12,500 francs CFA. The profit generated will help her to pay for food and new clothing for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to sell

loans.name: Algis Miguel

texts.es: Algis es un habitante de Soledad un municipio del departamento del Atlántico en donde reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos, desde muy joven estuvo vinculado al comercio de electrodomésticos, actividad que inició con sus propios ahorros y con la que ha ofrecido bienestar a su familia. Sus principales clientes se encuentran en esta localidad, sin embargo su base de clientes se ha expandido a municipios vecinos quienes le solicitan todo tipo de electrodomésticos y los más solicitados son las lavadoras, neveras y ventiladores, los cuales ofrece con facilidad de pago según el flujo de efectivo de su cliente.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para responder a unos pedidos; lavadoras, hornos y ventiladores. Con esta inversión podrá responder oportunamente a las solicitudes de pedidos de sus clientes, así mismo tendrá un inventario de productos conforme a la demanda.  Su meta a futuro es tener su propia red de distribución y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Algis is from Soledad, a town in the department of Atlántico where he lives with his spouse and children.  Since he was very young, he has been engaged in selling household appliances, an activity that he started with his own savings, and which enables him to provide for his family’s well-being.  His main customers are in his hometown, however, his customer base has expanded to neighboring towns where there is demand for all types of household appliances.  Washing machines, refrigerators, and fans are requested most often, and he offers easy payments depending on his customers’ cash flow.  Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to fulfill orders for washing machines, ovens, and fans.  With this investment, he will be able to respond to his customers’ requests in a timely manner as well as have an inventory of products to meet demand.  His future goal is to have his own distribution network, and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to respond to his customers’ requests for washig machines, ovens, and fans.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be intelligent. He operates a butchery where he sells meat, which has been involved in for 5 years. His business is located in a strategic place. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more meat. He hopes that in the future, he will have a wonderful family.

loans.use: to buy more meat

loans.name: Haliye

texts.en:
Haliye is 57 years old and living with her mother. For years she worked in public education centers, as a sewing and embroidery teacher. When her mother had health problems she started working from home, getting trousseaux orders and making them. With the help of the loan from MAYA, she bought fabric in bulk and lace.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Haliye Hanım 57 yaşında ve annesiyle birlikte yaşıyor. Uzun yıllar halk eğitim merkezlerinde dikiş nakış öğretmenliği yaptıktan sonra annesinin sağlık sorunları nedeniyle evden siparişle çeyiz işleri yapmaya başlamış. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile kumaş ve dantel aldı.

loans.use: to buy fabric and lace in bulk for making trousseaux.

loans.name: Sreymoa's Group

texts.en: Sreymoa’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreymoa makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Chicken And Duck Talk - N11Th1Qlưu Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sen is 45 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for seven years. Sen lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover, the market need is low in this region. In addition, the income from this business is unstable because when some disease affects her poultry, they could die so she has nothing to sell and she will be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Sen faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Sen joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Sen has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of Chicken and duck Talk - N11Th1QLưu, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Sen hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is grateful that she has received financial help numerous times in the past, help that she has always repaid on time. Those loans have certainly contributed to the efficient performance of her vehicles, thereby providing steady income to meet her family's needs. Hardworking as she is, she has also started selling fresh meat in her community.

Lilia has requested a 30000 PHP loan to pay for the annual registration of her van and tricycle for her transportation service. With part of the loan she will buy several kilos of fresh meat to sell as well. She is optimistic of a good return on her businesses and is praising God for your untiring support of her livelihood.

Lilia aims to buy a new van due to the costly maintenance of her old van. She also plans to acquire property for her family.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: pay for the annual registration of her vehicles and fresh meat from wholesalers to sell.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, chips, coffee, can goods, soft drinks, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling vegetables and raising pig.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marylou dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, chips, coffee, can goods, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Airis

texts.en:
Airis is 26 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Airis is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

Airis has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a married woman with five kids, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Martina operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables,cabbage and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, cabbage and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old and married with eleven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of household goods to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Animal Farm - N02Ntiếntnguyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngoan is 36 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising livestock for more than 10 years. Ngoan lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover, the market need is low in this region. In addition, the income from this business is unstable because when some disease affects her livestock, they can die and then she has nothing to sell and she will be in financial trouble. The main hardship that Ngoan faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Ngoan joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Ngoan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of Animal Farm - N02NTiếnTNguyên, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Ngoan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 48 years and her child is in school.

Jocelyn has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed in her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Joenne

texts.en: Joenne is 25 years old, the mother of one child who is in school, and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, snacks, home care products, and other groceries. Joenne has been in her current line of work for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as bread, canned goods, snacks, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 24 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de una hija de apenas 10 meses, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Jorge La Laguna, Sololá.
Jorge sabe que las cosas no vienen por si solas si uno tendrá que buscarlos, entonces con la mentalidad de superación el decidió apenas hace un año trabajar de albañil y con mucha dedicación aunque apenas tenga poca experiencia ha logrado  que la gente busque sus servicios, se sabe muy bien que en su comunidad trabajar de albañil no es un trabajo fijo, por lo que para obtener otros ingresos se dedica a la elaboración de pulseras. Jorge con lo que ha obtenido de sus dos trabajos su casa ha empezado a construir pero lamentablemente ahora ya no está dentro de sus posibilidades finalizar la fundición de la terraza de su casa, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para comprar cemento, arena, piedrín.
Su más grande anhelo es  finalizar la construcción de su casa, y él confía plenamente en este crédito que lo ayudara a superarse.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 24 year old man. He is single, and his beautiful family is comprised of a daughter who is just ten months old. This unassuming family lives in the community of San Jorge La Laguna, Sololá.
Jorge knows that things don’t come by themselves, you have to look for them. Just a year ago, with his mind set on succeeding, he decided to work as a mason, and although he had just a little experience, with much dedication, he managed to find people looking for his services. He is well aware that working as a mason isn’t a steady job in his community and, for this reason, he earns additional income making bracelets. With the earnings from his two jobs, Jorge began to build his home. Regrettably, however, now it is not within his means to complete the terrace’s foundation and, for this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, and stone.
His greatest desire is to complete construction of his home, and he is fully confident that this loan will help him succeed.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Muminboy

texts.ru: Муминбой мужчина 30 лет. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Муминбой живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он также занимается своим бизнесом. Муминбой занимается дехканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Муминбой занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Муминбой хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Муминбой заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Muminboy is a 30-year-old man. He is married and has 2 children. Muminboy lives with his wife in a small house in a rural village. In order to feed his family, he has his own business. Muminboy works as an independent farmer and cattle-breeder. He has a plot of land. Out of the total area of land, parts of the land are dry earth, and the rest is irrigated. On this land, Muminboy grows carrots, potatoes, and grain.

Muminboy's wife helps him tend and raise livestock. Because their plot of land is large, they also pasture their animals on it. Their animal husbandry business brings in a good income, so Muminboy wants to expand this business, increasing his headcount of livestock. In order to do this, he has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan to buy livestock. Muminboy thanks MDO Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Мукаррам  доброжелательная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем. Мукаррам живет вместе со своей семьёй в городе Истаравшан, она  работает центральной больнице санитаркой. Всё что она зарабатывает, расходуется на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег для другие более перспективные цели.  Мукаррам хочет сделать ремонт у себя дома. Но у неё не хватает денежных средств.  Она  обратилась в ООО МДО Арванд за получением кредита. Она очень благодарна ООО МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и доверие оказанную ей.
texts.en:
Mukarram is a benevolent and hard-working woman. She is 56 years old, married, and lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan, where she works as an orderly in the central hospital. Everything that she earns is spent on supporting her family. She does not have the ability to save money for any other long-term goals.

Mukarram wants to repair her house, but she does not have the funds to do so. She has applied to MDO Arvand, LLC to receive a loan. She is very thankful to MDO Arvand for the support and trust they have shown her.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Linlie

texts.en: Linlie is married, 33 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy gasoline, nets and other fishing supplies. She has been in this business for six years and, in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Friendly Farm - N7Th3Tnhấtqvinh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy is 30 years old and she is married. She has been raising poultry for seven years. Thúy lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover, the market need is low in this region. In addition, her income is unstable because when some disease affects her poultry, they could die and then she would have nothing to sell and she would be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Thúy faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby chickens and ducks to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Thúy is the group leader of Friendly farm - N7Th3TNhấtQVinh, which consists of four members.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens and ducks to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Since 2005, she has earned a living by making handmade souvenirs, clothes and many other items. She runs this business from her house and is very happy with her loyal customers. Her goal is to help her husband support their family, but the money the two parents make is barely enough to cover her family's increasing needs and expenses. Hala's top priority is to pay for her children's education, and she is requesting this loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay their tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 from NWTF to buy more fish to dry and sell. Norma has been in this business for two years and earns more money by fishing. She has sustained her business through her own hard work and with help from loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to make more dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер, жизнерадостный, энергичный мужчина. Женат имеет двоих детей. Основная работа Алишера дехканство, этим он зарабатывает на жизнь. У него почти 30 га земли, там он выращивает разные овощи и продает их. Он мало получает урожай из за нехватки воды, но не жалуется, потому что он привык жить скромно и ему этого достаточно. Они очень дружные, поэтому они все вместе работают на поле, помогая друг другу. На следующий сезон он надеется на хороший урожай но данный момент у него  проблемы. Так как его земля очень большая, нет воды, он поставил насос, но его трубы сломались и он хочет взамен купить новые. Таких больших денег у него нету поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом, заранее благодарен за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Alisher is a joyful, energetic man. He is married, and has two children. Alisher primarily works as an independent "dehkan" farmer, which is how he earns enough money to live. He has nearly 30 hectares of land, where he grows various vegetables and sells them. He does not get very good harvests because there is not enough water, but he doesn't complain, because he is used to living humbly, and he has enough.

His family is very harmonious, so they all work together in the field, helping each other. Next season, Alisher hopes for a good harvest, but at the moment he has some problems. Because he has so much land and no water, he built a pump, but his pipes burst and he wants to buy new pipes to replace them. He does not have the large amount of money that this would require, so he has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. He is thankful in advance for the support!

loans.use: to buy pipe to irrigate his farm.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 9,000 from NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Arlyn has been in this business for the last five years and earns additional income by selling food. She has sustained her business by hard work and with help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marcionila

texts.en:
Marcionila is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marcionila is 47 years old and four of her children are in school.

Marcionila has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marcionila requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, vegetables, oil, etc.

Marcionila has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Marcionila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, vegetables and oil

loans.name: Miriam De Jesus

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de cuarenta y un años de edad,  muy perseverante y trabajadora, madre de cuatro hijos que ha logrado sacar adelante siendo madre soltera. Ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de nacatamales y platanitos, los cuales vende de forma ambulante y por encargo. También con sus ganancias ha ido invirtiendo en la compra de ropa nueva que vende en su vecindario.
Ella ya ha trabajado con financiamientos de Kiva junto a MiCrédito y está muy agradecida. En estos momentos ha vuelto a recurrir a otro préstamo, que le permita abastecerse y comprar materia prima para elaborar los nacatamales y los plantanitos, además pueda invertir en la comprar de más ropa y accesorios para mujeres, dado que ha visto que este es un negocio que también puede explotar, Miriam es una mujer emprendedora con muchas metas, que no va a descansar hasta verlas cumplidas.
texts.en:
Miriam, 41, is very persevering and hardworking. She is the mother of four children, and has managed to get ahead as a single mother. She has a business making “nacatamales” [traditional steamed corncakes] and “platanitos” [green plantain chips], which she sells on foot and custom made. In addition, she has invested her profits in the purchase of new clothing that she sells in her neighborhood.
She has already worked with Kiva loans along with MiCrédito, and is very grateful. At this time, she has returned to request another loan, which will allow her to stock up and purchase ingredients to make the “nacatamales” and the “plantanitos”. In addition, she will purchase more women’s clothing and accessories given that she has noticed that this is a business that she can explore as well. Miriam is an enterprising woman with many goals, and she isn’t going to rest until she sees them completed.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make "nacatamales" and "platanitos".

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a hardworking father married to Agnes, a vendor. He is a new member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) from the Intramuros branch and currently has been driving his own tricycle for eight years now as a source of income. Every month, he’s earning about PHP 12,000.

Jolly can manage his time since he is driving his own vehicle, which is one of the advantages. However, vehicle maintenance is one of the challenges in the business since he’s lacking supporting capital. With this, he’s thinking of ways to get bigger earnings. That’s why Jolly decided to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. The amount will be added to his current savings to buy another unit of tricycle.

Jolly is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. There he gains spiritual strength from the members' life changing testimony, shares his own experience with God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy another unit of tricycle.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP s,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like yeast, egg, sugar, flour, baking soda, etc.

Lourdes has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like yeast, eggs, sugar, flour, and baking soda

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Wendy is 28 years old and has five children. Wendy is married and has three children who are in school.

Wendy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Wendy requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Wendy has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wendy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Linda Vema Group

texts.fr: Buunda est une femme d’affaires, membre d’un groupe solidaire, Linda Vema, cliente de l’Imf Hekima, agée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de sept enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de produits manufacturés dans une boutique dans le centre commercial de la ville. Elle va s’approvisionner en matelas, savons, biscuits, sel, farine de formant, etc. Elle compte accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie l’IMF Hekima pour avoir songé aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système classique bancaire.
texts.en:
Buunda is a businesswoman. She is a member of a loan group, Linda Vema, which is a client of IMF Hekima. Buunda is 50 years old, married, and the mother of seven children who all go to school. She sells manufactured products in a boutique in the city’s shopping center.

She will buy sugar, salt, flour, etc. She wants to grow her business and educate and feed her children. In closing, she would like to thank IMF Hekima for thinking of small entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: S’approvisionner en matelas, savons, biscuits, sel, farine de formant, etc

loans.name: Deliza

texts.en:
Deliza works hard to support her family. Deliza is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Deliza has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Deliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 44 years old and has two children. Myrna is married and has two children who are in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Myrna has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sokkim's Group

texts.en:
Sokkim, 37, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three schoolchildren. Nowadays, her main incomes that she can support on her family’s living are from growing cassava and rice for 19-year. She can save her daily income from her both businesses about 6 USD per day. This year, the cassava price is getting lower, which causes her to earn a very low income.

Sokkim is the group leader of two members to seeking a new loan with VisionFund and this is her second micro loan. As the result, her family condition is getting better than before because of the previous loan. She will spend her new loan in order to purchase more fertilizer to improve her cassava and buy more seed to increase the cassava yield. She hopes that she can get higher yield from her cassava farm via this loan, so she can get more income to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to increase the cassava yield so  that she can get more income to upgrade her living standard.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past one year, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Jevevive

texts.en:
Jenevieve is married, and she is a mother of three children. They live in a four bedroom house in the North West Region of Cameroon. She had a difficult moment when she lost her father and armed robbers attacked her that same day taking away most of her property. 

She was advised by her friends to join GHAPE, she became a member of GHAPE in 2011, and she has taken and repaid EC three times.

With this new loan requested, Jevevive will buy threads, a sewing machine, and material to make dresses. She is confident that this business will succeed because she has been sowing and selling dresses for a long time. The demand for dresses is high because we need clothing every day. She has a lot of experience and many customers. She also has a good  site.The community will benefit from her activity in that they will buy dresses at all times and at cheaper rates. 

With the profit made from this loan, Jevevive will complete their house, and sponsor her offspring, help other children in the family, and poor people around her. 

Jevevive prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals; members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed; and members form a social network.

loans.use: To buy threads, a sewing machine, and material to make dresses

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Her name is Adoracion, aged 45, from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eugenio, a factory employee, with whom she has three children, of which one is in college and the other two are in high school.

Her husband's salary is not enough to meet the growing needs of a family of four, so this drove Adoracion to open a small general store where she is seen in her photo. Aside from her store, she also has a small bakery and a computer shop to augment their income and send their three children to school.

She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She hires employees for her bakery and computer shop businesses, but she oversees all her businesses to ensure good management.

To help her expand her newly opened Smart "Padala" business (money remittance center), she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to infuse additional funds to operate her Smart "Padala," which are mostly domestic remittances of factory workers and employees who send money to their loved ones.

Since her center is near an industrial zone, a lot of her clients are from the nearby electronic factories. She will be grateful for your help to assist her in her businesses. She allots a good amount of her earnings for her children's education and for their house amortization.

Adoracion dreams of having more remittance centers someday and having savings for her children's college educations. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To infuse additional  funds needed for Smart "Padala" (remittance center) business.

loans.name: Aima

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aima works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Aima is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Aima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sarita Brigitte

texts.es:
Sarita es una joven estudiante que vive junto a su familia. Ella le gusta la contabilidad, pero siempre aspiraba a más, por eso decidió estudiar Administración Industrial en SENATI, porque es una carrera más amplia y una de las más demandadas hoy en día. Aún le faltan 2 años por terminar, cuando eso suceda sabe que la beneficiará mucho en lo profesional y en lo familiar porque le permitirá tener la estabilidad económica que tanto anhela.

Sarita se siente feliz con lo que está estudiando, le va muy bien en sus estudios, le dedica 38 horas a la semana a sus estudios. Cuando culmine su carrera, piensa trabajar como Administradora en una importante empresa y tener la estabilidad económica que le permita apoyar a su familia.

Sus padres no cuentan con un trabajo fijo, lo que les dificulta seguir apoyándola con el pago de sus mensualidades. Es por ello, que solicita apoyo de KIVA con este crédito para que pueda solventar los gastos de sus estudios. Al haber logrado este crédito se siente bien y aliviada porque podrá continuar sus estudios hasta concluirlos en el tiempo estimado.

Ella quiere expresarles unas palabras a quienes la puedan apoyar:"Se siente bien al saber que personas de todo el mundo quieran apoyarme aún si conocerme. Daré todo de mi para agradecerles por su ayuda. Muchas gracias por brindarme su apoyo, porque podré terminar mi carrera a tiempo y ser una excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Sarita is a young student who lives with her family.  She likes accounting, but always wanted more, so she decided to study Industrial Management in SENATI, because it is a broader career and one that is in most demand today.  

She is two years away from finishing.  When that happens, she knows it will benefit her professionally and family-wise because it will allow her to have the economic stability she craves.

Sarita is very happy with what she is studying.  She is doing very well in her studies.  She spends 38 hours a week on her studies.  When she finishes her career, she thinks she will work as an administrator in a large company, and have the financial stability that will allow her to support her family.

Her parents do not have a steady job, making it difficult to continue to support her with her monthly payments. She is therefore requesting support from KIVA with this loan,  so she can cover the costs of her studies.  After acquiring this loan she will feel relieved that she can continue with her studies in order to be able to conclude them in the estimated time.

She wants to express a few words to those who can lend a hand:   "It feels good to know that people around the world want to support me even without knowing me.   I will put in all that I can to express my gratitude for all their help.  Thank you for giving me your support, because I can finish my career on time and become an excellent professional."

loans.use: To cover the costs of studies in Industrial Management

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La Socia Amelia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de andamios metalicos,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de andamios metalicos.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para hacer trabajos de andamios metálicos como metales pinturas y clavos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member, Amelia, continues to devote herself to the business of selling metallic scaffolding. Through this business she wishes to move forward. Her dream is to expand the the business. She requests a loan to purchase materials to do the work of metal scaffolding like metal paints and nails. She is happy for the the loan and commits herself to making her repayments.

loans.use: the member who is requesting the loan to buy materials to make metallic scaffolding like metal paints and nails.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 43 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Allen is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Allen has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from nipa roofing making (thatched roof made from the leaves of the Nipa palm).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Andrea Marisa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia es una persona muy trabajadoarq ue por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venra de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues dedicating herself to the business of buying and selling clothing. She is a very hard-working person who, by means of this business, is moving her family forward. Her dream is to expand the business of selling clothing. The member requests the loan to purchase trouser, blouses, and sweater.

The members is happy for the loan and commits to complying with the repayments.

loans.use: to purchase trouser, blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: Shandy Rocio

texts.es:
La socia Shandy Rocio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia es una persona muy trabajadora,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rocio Shandy continues to work in the business of selling dried grains such as corn, wheat and quinoa.  This member is a very hardworking person.  Her dream is to expand her grain selling business. The member is requesting a loan to buy corn, barley and wheat.

The member is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a young entrepreneur and a mother of two elementary students. She’s from Intramuros, Philippines and a new member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). As a source of income, her husband, Inocencio is working as a security guard while Margie is managing their own computer shop. In the Philippines, computers in an internet cafe are paid by hours, usually ranges from P15.00 to P20.00. While there are internet cafes where a machine is attached on each computer somehow like a vendo machine where customers drop P1.00 coin. Each coin is equivalent to a 5 minutes usage of the computer and internet. That’s how Margie’s internet café works. It is also known as “piso net” in the Philippines. Piso which means “Philippine peso”.

The Internet café provides P8, 000 monthly earnings and Margie is aiming to add computers and have her own place where she’ll not anymore pay for the monthly rental. Every time a computer needs to be fixed is what she considered a challenge since she doesn’t have supplementary capital to pay for the technician and buy necessary materials. With this, Margie decided to apply for a P10, 000 loan for the computer maintenance and upgrade.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Margie spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: for use on computer maintenance in her internet cafe

loans.name: Jorge Arturo

texts.es: Jorge de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al viaje de pasajeros via maritima desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para darle mantenimiento a su lancha ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabajo e ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 38 years old and lives at home with his family group.  He works in passenger-travel-by-sea for 4 years now.  With the income that he obtains from this work he is able to absolve some household expenses.  

He is requesting a loan so that he will be able to give his boat some maintenance because that is his main source of employment and income.

loans.use: to give some maintenance to his boat

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a corn vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amelita is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy more corn and other supplies to use in her business for her corn vending business.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more corn and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Loremae

texts.en:
Loremae is an operator of one motorized tricycle. She hired one cautious and knowledgeable driver for the vehicle. Tricycle is one of the common means of public transportation in the Philippines. Each month she’s earning for approximately P12, 000 and she’s using it to support her family’s day-to-day expenditures.

Aside on her current business, Loremae is also planning to manage a food business. She wants to cook and sell viands for lunch and dinner since Loremae wants to earn more daily for her family. However she’s lacking capital to start the business. With this, she applied for a loan of P10, 000 as an added capital. She’s praying that God will touch the hearts of people who has the capability to help and return abundant blessings to them.

On a weekly basis, Loremae regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to have added capital for the food business that she wants to establish.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small business selling men's ready-made garments for many years. He purchases clothing from the market at wholesale price and sells it for higher prices from his garments store. The people of town like his garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the Muslim holiday (Eid-Ul-Adha) is about to come and people are demanding the latest variety of jeans. He pays the shop rent, meets all the household expenses from his earnings and contributes some earnings for savings as well.

Hina has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a variety of jeans and shirts to fulfill the demand. She wishes for a bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jeans and shirts for her husband's garments store.

loans.name: Will Alfredo

texts.es: Will tiene 34 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija de 6 años de edad a la que se siempre está buscando la manera de sacar adelante él solo. Will se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa cercana a su vivienda, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, además los fines de semana él se dedica a comprar y vender ganado bovino. Will desea construir un muro de retención en su vivienda, ya que el teme que su hija pueda tener un accidente, además que desea brindar mayor protección a su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro de retención y proteger a su hija.
texts.en:
Will is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his 6 year old daughter, whom he is always looking out for and trying to get ahead on his own.

Will works by providing his services in a nearby company near his home.  This allows him to support his home financially.  In addition, on weekends, he works in the business of buying and selling cattle.

Will wants to build a retaining wall in his home, as he fears that his daughter might have an accident.  He also wants to provide greater protection for his home.

He is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in: brick, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a retaining wall and thus be able to protect his daughter.

loans.use: To invest in: brick, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a retaining wall and protect her daughter.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está estudiando la carrera de obstetricia, comenta que su meta es poder tener su título para poder trabajar y ejercer su profesión para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que con sacrificio y lucha está pudiendo estudiar. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is studying to be an Obstetrician. She says that her goal is to be able to finish her degree in order to exercise her profession so she can help others.

She is a hard working and enterprising young woman who has managed to get this far through great sacrifice. She is asking for this loan in order to pay the fees associated with her degree so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay fees associated with her degree.

loans.name: Paul

texts.es:
Paul es una persona que está estudiando la carrera de marketing, trabaja y estudia para así solventar sus gastos y a la vez ayudarle a su familia.
Su meta es recibirse en su profesión y poder trabajar para mejorar su vida y ayudar a sus seres queridos. 
Él es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida y por medio de sus estudios poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Paul is studying for a degree in marketing, and he works and studies in order to pay his expenses while helping his family. His goal is to earn his professional degree and be able to work in order to improve his life and help his loved ones.

He is working hard to be able to be somebody in life, and to be somebody in life by means of his studies. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his tuition, and this way, be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay college tuition.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es:
Reyna, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, luego empezó en la universidad pero la abandono al tener que realizar un viaje al extranjero, está casada, su esposo es comerciante, tiene una tienda de la que también genera ingresos para el hogar, tiene dos hijos que viven con ella y estudian; en su casa también vive su mamá y unos hermanos de ella. 

Reyna, tiene un comedor en donde vende pupusas, panes con pollo y refrescos, tiene 5 meses de haber iniciado este negocio, la necesidades de generar ingresos la llevó a tomar esta iniciativa de trabajo; y cuando cierra el comedor, su esposo le ayuda con la tienda y el horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. a 11:00 a.m.     

El préstamo será invertido para comprar una plancha más grande, para cubrir la demanda que tiene y mejorar la atención a sus clientes.

Los sueños de Reyna son, que sus ventas crezcan y apoyar a sus hijos para que se prepararen académicamente y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 37, completed high school and later entered the university, but she dropped out when she had to go abroad. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. She has a store with which she also generates income for the household. She has two children who live with her and are studying, and her mother and brothers also live with her.

Reyna has a small restaurant in which she sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas], panes con pollo [hot chicken sandwiches], and soft drinks. She started this business five months ago because the need to generate income led her to take on this work. When she closes the restaurant, her husband helps her with the store. The service hours are from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan will be invested in purchasing a bigger griddle, in order to meet her demand and improve the service for her customers.

Reyna's dreams are to grow her sales and support her children, so that they may prepare themselves academically and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase a larger griddle.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre joven, que desde hace siete años decidió emprender su propio negocio de pulpería, al lado de su esposa han logrado hacer crecer su tienda poco a poco. Miguel ha logrado surtirse y meter en su inventario productos con los que antes no contaba. 
En estos momentos, ha recurrido a un préstamo, que planea invertir en la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, productos de higiene personal entre otros, dado que su demanda ha ido creciendo notablemente y dentro de poco su pequeña tienda va tomando forma de una distribuidora. En un futuro planea mejorar la infraestructura de su local además invertir en otros negocios.
texts.en:
Miguel is a young man who seven years ago decided to start his own grocery business.  Along with his wife, they have managed to gradually expand their store. 

Miguel has managed to stock up and put into his inventory products that previously he did not have.

Currently, he is requesting a loan which he plans to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, hygiene products, among others.  Demand has grown significantly and soon his small shop is taking the shape of a distributor. 

In the future he plans to improve the infrastructure of his locale.  He would also like to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, hygiene products and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy threads to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith de 59 años, su vida laboral inició desde su juventud al incorporarse en una empresa privada y tiempo después ofreció servicio doméstico, sin embargo decidió ser una trabajadora independiente para poder cuidar de su padre y dedicar más tiempo a su familia.  Judith es viuda y madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, su actividad comercial le genera ingresos para su autosustento en la cual lleva 15 años, ella comercializa tendidos de cama y toallas, y aprovechando sus dotes culinarios elabora Hayacas y Bolis de frutas.  Todos los días de la semana a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. Judith está dispuesta a atender a su clientela que en su gran mayoría son habitantes del sector donde reside al sur del municipio de Barranquilla.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en mercancías que sus clientes le han solicitado; sabanas y toallas, así mismo víveres para la preparación de sus Hayacas. Su meta a futuro es comprar un enfriador y ayudar a que sus hijos puedan tener su casa.
texts.en:
Judith is 59. She has been working since her youth, when she joined a private business and later worked as a housekeeper. However, she decided to work independently in order to take care of her father and devote more time to her family. Judith is a widow, and she has two adult children.

For 15 years, her business activity has generated income for her to support herself. She sells bed linens and towels, and uses her culinary gifts to make hallacas [similar to tamales] and fruit pops. Every day of the week from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., Judith is there to wait on her customers, who are mainly residents of the southern part of the municipality of Barranquilla, where she lives.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in merchandise that her customers have requested: sheets and towels, as well as supplies for making her hallacas. Her future goal is to buy a cooler and help her children to be able to have a house.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise that her customers have requested: sheets and towels, as well as supplies for making hallacas [similar to tamales].

loans.name: Myrna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mirna es una mujer de cincuenta y tres años de edad, honesta, responsable y trabajadora. Hace un tiempo emprendió en su hogar un negocio de estilismo y asesoría de imagen, dado que esto es lo que le apasiona, gracias al apoyo de su esposo ha logrado comprar poco a poco los utensilios y materiales necesarios para brindar la mejor atención a sus clientes. 
En estos momentos, ha descubierto en Kiva y MiCrédito una oportunidad para crecer, por eso ha solicitado un préstamo que le permita comprar una plancha alisadora para cabello, shampoo, set de tijeras y peines, pinturas de uña, maquillaje entre otras cosas que necesita para ejercer su profesión. En futuro desea poner su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Myrna is a woman of fifty-three years, honest, responsible and hardworking. Some time ago she launched a styling and image consultancy business out of her home, since this is what she is passionate about. Thanks to the support of her husband she has gradually managed to buy the tools and materials needed to provide the best service to her clients.

Now, she has discovered that through Kiva and MiCrédito she has an opportunity to grow. So she has applied for a loan to allow her to buy an iron for hair straightening, shampoo, a set of scissors and combs, nail paints, makeup and other things that she needs to ply her profession.
