In the future she wants to have her own salon.

loans.use: To buy an iron for straightening hair, shampoo, a set of scissors and combs, nail paints, makeup and more.

loans.name: Blanca Ysabel

texts.es:
Blanca, de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de panes rellenos de pollo y también a la venta de golosinas tradiciones de su municipio, su arduo trabajo la ha llevado a ser muy reconocida en su comunidad; está casada y vive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad, ella estudio hasta octavo grado, con el dinero que obtiene de las ventas que realiza, ayuda a sus padres para que compren medicamentos y para que compren comida y cubran otras necesidades. 

Blanca, aprendió este negocio, gracias a su mamá, quien la apoyo siempre y le educo para que fuera una persona de bien.- Blanca, también formo parte de un curso de cosmetología, impartido por programas de gobierno.
 
El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una plancha para continuar con su negocio, porque la que tiene ya está demasiado deteriorada, pero también comprará una licuadora e insumos para su negocio; esto traerá mejores ingreso para ella y su familia.

Los sueño de Blanca, son que su negocio crezca día a día y ampliar más el lugar de su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca, 28 years old, makes a living selling chicken-stuffed breads and also traditional sweets from her town. Her hard work has led her to be well known in her community. She is married and lives with her husband and her 2-year-old son. She studied up to eighth grade. With the money obtained from the sales she makes, she helps her parents to buy medicines, to buy food, and meet other needs.

Blanca learned this business thanks to her mother, who always supported her and raised her to be a good person. Blanca also took part in a cosmetology course, taught by government programs.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a griddle to continue with her business, because the one she has is too worn, but she will also buy a blender and supplies for her business; this will bring better income for her and her family.

Blanca's dreams are for her business to grow day by day and to further expand her business place.

loans.use: to buy a griddle, a blender, and other supplies to continue with her business.

loans.name: Sakuntala

texts.en:
Sakuntala, 45, is a resident of a small village of Bolangir, Odisha, India. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. She has a family of four who are affected by the sanitary crisis. They have to travel long distances to attend nature's call, which is their major concern.

Sakuntala is from a low-income household and possesses very limited resources. She was never able to build a toilet in her home due to her financial constraints, and many a time she has suffered from infections due to this reason.

Therefore, Sakuntala is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a new, well-equipped toilet in her home so that she can prevent herself and her family from harmful diseases and infections, thereby reducing her medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a new, well-equipped toilet.

loans.name: Dipanjali

texts.en:
Dipanjali, 43, is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Bolangir, Odisha, India. She is married to her husband, who is a mason by occupation. They are blessed with two sons who are engaged with furniture work.

Due to poverty, she was never able to build a toilet in her home. She is one of the millions who are affected by the sanitation crisis. She has to travel a long distance to get access to a public toilet. She wants to improve her living condition.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a latrine in her house. This will help her in promoting cleanliness, and thus safeguard the health of her family and prevent them from harmful contagious diseases. Dipanjali is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a latrine in her house.

loans.name: Pramadini

texts.en:
Pramadini, 41, a woman with great ideas and a creative mind, is a very ambitious woman. She hails from a village of Bolangir, Odisha, India. Her family comprises her husband, who is a grocer, and two daughters who are continuing their education. She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to build a latrine. Building a latrine will help her maintain the health and hygiene of her family and promote cleanliness in the community.

She is eagerly awaiting your help and support.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Ma. Nita is a 62-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with four adult children.

Ma. Nita's husband does a fishing business to earn a living while Ma. Nita helps her husband by buying and selling dried fish. She has been doing this for almost 32 years.

To uplift her livelihood, Ma. Nita needs an additional amount to buy more dried fish to sell. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Sweden

texts.en:
Sweden is a married woman with three children aged eleven, six, and she has a one-month-old daughter. She is 29 years old and a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo where most of the community is engaged in fishing. Thus, Sweden and her husband are also engaged in fishing to earn a living.

Aside from fishing, Sweden runs a sari-sari (variety) store to earn additional income. She has been doing this for five years.

Sweden wishes to borrow money to buy a new engine for their fishing boat and to buy grocery items such as spices, canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, chocolate drink, biscuits, candies and chips.

In the future, Sweden wishes to increase their livelihood to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for their fishing boat, spices, canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, chocolate drink, biscuits, candies and chips.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es:
Vivian es una joven estudiante, es de la ciudad de Santaní, empleada de una casa de Ventas de comestibles, es una persona trabajadora, honesta y  responsable es muy dedicada al estudio.
Su meta es de tener su título y poder trabajar de forma independiente, está estudiando la carrera de odontología, y por medio de ella quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas para poder ayudarles con su salud bucal.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y continuar así con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Vivian is a young student from the city of Santaní. She is an employee in a food sales business. She is a hard-working person, honest and responsible and she is very dedicated to her studies.

Her goal is to obtain her degree and be able to work independently. She is studying dentistry and by doing this she wants to be able to help others with their oral health.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her courses and continue with her studies

loans.use: to pay the fees for her studies.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a 52-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with three school-aged children aged 19, 17 and 15 years old.

Annabel and her husband are engaged in fishing like other community members. They have been doing this for 25 years.

To uplift their livelihood, Annabel is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net, fishing weigh, fishing knot and crab net (others called this a crab trap) to increase their catch.

In the future, Annabel wishes to increase their earnings to have enough money to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing weighs, fishing knot and crab net.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 51 years old, married and has four children.

Vivian is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Vivian has been in this business for two years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Vivian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Amridin

texts.ru: Этого счастливого отца и глава семейства зовут Амридин. Ему 43 года. Амридин отец  детей и любимый муж. Он вместе с семьей живет на районе Кубодиён. В этом районе он занимается животноводством. Амридин начинает свою работу с раннего утра до самого вечера. Он любит свою работу и унаследовал эту деятельность от своих родителей. Амридин принял решение расширить животноводческую деятельность и принести в дом больше дохода, так как дети растут и растут их расходы. С каждым днем ему становится труднее прокормить семью. Амридин планирует на заемные средства приобрести пару голов телят и увеличить поголовья скотин с такими намерениями он обращается за займом.
texts.en:
Meet Amridin, a happy father and head of his family. Amridin is 43, married, and he lives with his wife and children in the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan where he is involved in animal husbandry.  His work day starts early in the morning and is not over until the evening.  Amridin loves his work, which he inherited from his parents.

Amridin has decided to expand his animal husbandry activity so that he can bring more money home.  With every passing day he finds it more difficult to feed his family.  He is planning to use his loan to buy a couple of calves and increase his livestock headcount.  It is with this goal in mind that he has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Pardahol

texts.ru: Пардахол трудолюбивая  женщина.  Ей 46  лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей.  Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Пардахол вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Пардахол выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Пардахол получает хороший доход. Муж Пардахол также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Пардахол с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Пардахол заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Pardahol is a hardworking woman.  She is 46, married, and she has five children.  In order to have a stable income to feed the family, she and her husband have decided to start their own business.  They are now involved in animal husbandry.  Pardahol raises livestock and sells milk and meat from her animals.  She makes a decent income from this activity.  In addition to farming, her husband also works in a local workshop, and this constitutes an additional source of income for the family.  Thanks to their combined incomes, Pardahol and her husband enjoy an average standard of living and, at the moment, they have enough resources to cover all their needs.

Pardahol and her husband want to buy a few additional head of livestock for fattening.  For this reason, Pardahol has turned to Kiva's field partner, MDO Arvand, and requested a loan to buy livestock.  She thanks them in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Rosmery Roxana

texts.es:
Rosmery es una joven estudiante que vive junto a sus padres y hermanas mayores, ella es la menor. Eligió estudiar la carrera de Diseño Industrial, porque le agradó mucho desde pequeña. Aún le faltan 2 años para culminar su carrera. Al terminarla, ella sueña tener un trabajo seguro que le permita tener un buen ingreso económico y ayudar a su familia que tanto la apoyan con los gastos de sus estudios.

Sus padres no cuentan con un trabajo fijo, su hermana es quien trabaja pero los ingresos que genera son mínimos para lo que ella necesita. Es por ello, que ella está solicitando el apoyo de KIVA con este préstamo, que le permitirá pagar sus estudios y así terminar en el tiempo estimado. 

Ella sueña con seguir especializándose cuando acabe su carrera y trabajar en una importante empresa del rubro que le permita generar mayores ingresos para apoyar a su familia que tanto hacen por ella.

Rosmery quiere expresarles unas palabras: "Quiero agradecerles por el apoyo brindado, porque si no fuera por ustedes, tendría que dejar de estudiar. Me siento muy agradecida por su gran apoyo a pesar que no me conocen.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a young student who lives with her parents and older sisters; she is the youngest. She chose to study the field of Industrial Design, because it has enchanted her since childhood. She still has two years to go to complete her degree. She dreams of having a secure job after she graduates; one which will allow her to have a good income and help her family, who have greatly supported her with the costs of her studies.

Her parents do not have a steady job, her sister is the one who works, but the income generated is minimal for what she needs. That is why Rosmery is requesting the support of KIVA with this loan, which will allow her to finance her studies and thus graduate in the estimated time.

She dreams of continuing to specialize in her field when she completes her degree, and of working for a major company in a field that allows her to generate more income to support her family, who do so much for her.

Rosmery wants to say a few words to you: "I want to thank you for your support, because if it were not for you, I would have to leave school. I am very grateful for your great support, even though you do not know me.”

loans.use: to cover the costs of studying Industrial Design.

loans.name: Union Chichicasteco Group

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 11 y 18 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
María (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia desde hace 10 años se ha dedica a la compra y venta de güipiles esta labor lo realiza ella desde el mercado regional de su comunidad, y su esposo trabaja como albañil y juntos a su familia han sacado adelante.
María es una gran mujer que con su gran amabilidad y carisma ha acaparado la atención de sus clientes, porque les ofrece una variedad de güipiles de buena calidad y a un buen precio. Maria con el deseo de mejorar su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la comprar de más güipiles típicos y satisface mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de María es ver a sus hijos graduarse y construir una casa de terraza para que ellos vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman of 37. She is married and has a beautiful family of three children between the ages of 11 and 18. This beautiful family lives in a community of Sololá.

Maria (the first one on the right side in the photograph), with the desire to obtain income and meet the needs of her family, has been buying and selling traditional blouses for 10 years. She does this work from the regional market in her community. Her husband works as a mason, and together they are moving their family forward.

Maria is a wonderful woman who, with her great friendliness and charisma, has captured the attention of her customers because she offers them a variety of traditional blouses of good quality and at a good price. With the desire to improve her business, Maria has decided to apply for a loan for the purchase of more traditional blouses to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Maria's great dream is to see her children graduate and to build a terraced house so that they can live better.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional blouses

loans.name: Sohibjamol

texts.ru: Это Сохибжамол. Ей 56 лет. Она жительница района Кубадиён. Сохибжамол замужем и имеет детей. Ее муж работает учителем в школе. Сохибжамол каждый месяц ждет заработную плату мужа, она не стала ждать его денежных средств и начала открыть свой бизнес. Сейчас Сохибжамол занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она ухаживает за детьми, ведет домашнее хозяйство и одновременно занимается выращиванием скота. Сохибжамол на все успевает. Она одна ухаживает о домашних животных, ей тяжело, но она старается. Сейчас Сохибжамол хочет купить скота, чтобы развиваться дальше и не потерять источник дохода. У нее нет денег для купли скота, и она решила обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
Sohibjamol is 56 years old and a resident of the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  She is a wife and mother.  Her husband works as a school teacher.  Sohibjamol used to always wait for her husband's monthly salary.  She got tired of waiting for his money, so she decided to open her own business.  Today she is involved in agriculture.  She takes care of the children, of the house, and at the same time she raises livestock.  Somehow she finds the time to do everything.  She looks after the farm animals without any help; it is hard work, but she does as best as she can.

Sohibjamol wants to buy livestock in order to further grow her business and to avoid losing her source of income.  She doesn't have enough money for this purchase, which is the reason why she has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and has five children.  Gemma is married and has one child still in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gemma has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for his workshop, specifically a polisher and a drill to use for his work.

loans.name: Voeut's Group

texts.en:
Voeut is a 56-year-old mother of six children living in Battambang province. Two of her children are still in need of her support. She sells vegetables (cucumbers, beans, cabbage, etc) as her main source of income and works as a laborer for three years to supplement her income. She now leads a group of two to get the loan with VisionFund.

Voeut is able keep 4 USD as her daily savings. Her main business challenge is fewer customers. For Voeut, this is her third cycle with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loans. After she spent her previous loans, her family’s living is getting better. She will use her new loan portion to buy more kinds of vegetables to attract more customers. This will improve her current business bigger than before. She hopes that her business will run smoothly so that she can earn more income to upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie and her husband are engaged in fishing business to earn a living. She has been doing this business for 20 years. Julie is a 40-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with four school aged children ages 18, 17, 13 and 10 years old. In the future, she wishes to increase their livelihood to have better means of living. To help her reach her goal, she is asking a loan to buy fishing net and fishing rod.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing rod.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic commodities like chips, edible oil, sugar, mosquito repellent, soft drinks, shampoo, powdered soap and assorted groceries.
She is 46 year old married woman living in the town of Clarin, Bohol. She has been engaged in sari-sari(variety) store for 2 years now.

 She needs additional capital to be able to maintain the stocks of her store. She has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries like beverages, seasonings, and variety of canned goods. These are very essential for her to continue her day to day livelihood activity. Thus, it could help improve her earnings and able to pay her obligation. 
 She believes that someday her livelihood will become successful and productive for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries like beverages, seasonings, and variety of canned goods

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 33 years old and single with two children, two children are currently in school, Ailen works very hard to provide for them.

Ailen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snacks foods.

Ailen has been in this business for 5 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snacks foods

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is 54 years old, married with two children.

Leoniza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snacks foods.

Leoniza has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Leoniza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snacks foods

loans.name: Kimseng

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Takeo province, Kimseng is a 22-year-old and a mother of one child. She grows rice and tailors clothes to earn an income. In addition, she also works for others for a fee.

Kimseng has been with her businesses for two years. She can save around 8 USD per day. She already repaid her past loan with VisionFund and this is her third cycle loan. Her previous loans improved her family conditions. She will spend her new loan to buy a decent motorbike in order to drive to work on time. She hopes that she can save more time than before, so she can have enough time to improve on her rice farm, and her sewing business. This will help her to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to arrive at work on time and reduce the cost of transportation.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan, 43 years old married mother of 4 children. She has been baking since 2004 to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She has taken several loans earlier from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to help her family have better living standards. Today, she is acquiring a loan in order to arrange her daughter’s wedding and buy for her necessary bridal stuff. She is very excited about this wedding although she is going to miss her daughter very much. She wishes her daughter a lifetime of happiness.

loans.use: to arrange her daughter’s wedding and buy for her necessary bridal stuff

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 40-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her husband works as a chef and owns a small restaurant based on his experience. He offers many types of delicious foods, including breakfast and lunch for his customers. He has been running this restaurant for many years yet has generated insufficient profits due to his restaurant's poor condition.

His restaurant has scratched walls, low seating arrangements, dark lighting and no electricity supplies. Customers feel hesitant to enter his restaurant. He does not want to disappoint his dear customers as they enable his income.

Zareena's husband wants to redecorate his restaurant, including: painting the walls, providing an electrical supply, and buying new plastic furniture and crockery. Therefore, Zareena has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can maintain his restaurant in well manners so that it can look attractive. She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support.

loans.use: to help her husband redecorate his restaurant.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 43 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Margie has a personal collection business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock, such as powder, body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Margie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy powder, body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Divinia

texts.en:
Divinia is 49 years old, married with three children.

Divinia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snacks foods.

Divinia has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from butcher shop and buy and sell vegetables.

Divinia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snacks foods

loans.name: Kon

texts.en: Kon is a farmer that grows rice and vegetables for 20 years as her main source of her income.  Both of her businesses can save her about 6USD per day as her daily saving. Kon is 41 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is too young. Nowadays, they are living in Kratie province. This is first time for Kon with VisionFund and she will use her first loan portion to purchase more fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve her farming for good yield. This will help her buy more land to expand on her farmland larger than before. She hopes that she can gain more yields from her businesses, so she can increase her income to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to increase her crop yield so to earn more income to save for future need.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a farmer from the town of Pilar, Bohol. He is married and has two young children. For the last two years he has worked raising rice to earn a living.

Daniel has applied for an 8,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for laborers in his fields. He feels this loan could help him accomplish a greater harvest and higher income. He thus would be able to provide his family with a nutritious diet.

Daniel is determined to expand his farm and start raising hogs to supplement his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as  fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for laborers in his fields.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 50 years old and married with two children. For the past ten years she has fattened and sold pigs to earn a living in the Philippines. She also raises chickens to earn extra money.

Rubilyn has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is working tirelessly to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Veronica is 41 years old and has one child still in school.

Veronica has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables like onions, garlic, tomato and spices to sell to her local market.

Veronica has been in this business for 9 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like onions, garlic, tomato, spices to sell to her local market

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
SEEMA is a thirty-six years old and is a married woman. She belongs to a poor family because her husband could not adopt a profitable profession till yet.
Now she planned to buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings for her husband. This will help him provide a source of income. In this way her husband can generate a constant income for long time to take care of his whole family.
Therefore, SEEMA requested a loan for her husband so he can buy his own rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her husband, so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family.
SEEMA hopes that her husband will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She hopes to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband to create a mean of income for his family.

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en:
Medilyn is a married woman with four children with two of them currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Medilyn is 49 years old.

Medilyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Medilyn requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Medilyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Fardous

texts.en:
Fardous's husband has been selling sanitary goods for many years, including: water taps, geezers, sinks, joints, water pipes, elbows, shower, etc. He has earned a healthy income with his sanitary store.

Fardous was previously busy in another business, selling construction goods, which proved less profitable. He established the new business and hopes that it would prove more beneficial than last one. He retained a list of good customers in short time and this business is going well. He wants to make further investment to complete the remaining inventories for his newly established business but he does not have enough cash in hand for purchasing remaining inventories.

Therefore, Fardous requested a loan so that her husband can buy remaining stock for his sanitary store. She thanks Kiva and field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sanitary goods.

loans.name: Boushra

texts.en:
Boushra, 46, is married and has three children. Ten years ago she opened her own clothing shop, selling and tailoring clothes; before that time she used to work from her home.

Boushra’s business has positively affected her family's social and financial wellbeing. She continues working hard to keep building up her business in a well managed way so as to make sure she can support her husband in covering their family's living needs.

Boushra's main aim today is to provide her children with the best education possible. To that end she has applied for a 3,000 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children’s school tuition. She expects to continue developing and managing her business properly while providing her children with an excellent education.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school tuition.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children, six of whom are in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

Elena has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, coffee, canned goods, rice, condiments, and other groceries.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jerusa

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jerusa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Jerusa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Jerusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 44-year-old married father of three children. He works in providing transportation services as his only source of making a living.
Husein is working hard to develop his family's living, especially providing his children with the necessary education which will bring them a brighter future.

His income is good enough to cover his family's daily living needs, but a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will help him pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees.

He hopes that in the future he can improve his business for a better income.

loans.use: to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, meat, fish, spices, and other materials for her food production business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, meat, fish, spices, and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Eufracia is 60 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eufracia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Eufracia has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soap, coffee, vinegar, junk foods, candies, beverages, and other groceries.

In the future Eufracia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Omar Hector

texts.es:
Omar es un joven estudiante que nació en Cerro de Pasco, ciudad que se encuentra ubicada en el altiplano Peruano. Él emigró desde muy pequeño a Lima junto a su familia, en busca de un mejor futuro para todos. 

Él eligió estudiar la carrera de Electrónica Industrial porque desde muy pequeño le llamó la atención de cómo funcionan las cosas electrónicas. El mayor beneficio que tendrá cuando culmine su carrera, es que podrá sustentar sus propios gastos y podrá apoyar a su familia. Él le dedica 45 horas a la semana a sus estudios. Lleva estudiando ya un año, le faltan 2 años para concluirla. Piensa trabajar en el área de Programación de una importante empresa, como es Ferreyros.

Sus padres no cuentan con ingreso fijo, lo que les imposibilita seguir apoyando a Omar en sus estudios. Es por ello que, recurre al apoyo de KIVA para poder continuar estudiando, este préstamo lo utilizará para poder solventar los gastos de su carrera y continuar especializándose. Lo ayudará a culminar su carrera profesional, logrando realizarse como persona frente al ámbito laboral y social.

Su mayor sueño, es formar su propia empresa de equipos electrónicos de buena calidad, que sean competitivas y que brinden un mejor desarrollo a nuestro país. El mayor obstáculo que se le presenta para que eso suceda es el factor económico.

Omar quiere expresarles unas líneas a todas las personas de KIVA que lo apoyan con este préstamo:"Me siento bien porque al recibir su apoyo, no tendré ningún obstáculo para culminar mis estudios. Muchas gracias por el apoyo que me están brindando, sé que con esto podré superarme como persona. Muchas gracias, y no les fallaré.
texts.en:
Omar is a young student who was born in Cerro de Pasco, a city located in the highlands of Peru. He moved to Lima with his family as a small child, in search of a better future for them all.

As a very young man, Omar chose to study for a career in Industrial Electonics. The way electronic things function caught his attention. The great advantage he will have on completing his course work is that he can cover his own costs and support his family. Omar spends 45 hours a week in study, has been in school for one year, and still must go for two more years to complete his studies. He plans to work in the Programming field for an important company such as Ferreyros.

Omar's parents do not have a fixed income, which has made it impossible for them to keep supporting Omar in his studies. That is why he has turned to KIVA for the help needed to be able to stay in school. Omar will use the loan to pay costs for studying Industrial Electronics and continue becoming a specialist. The loan will help him complete his professional preparation and become a person who can succeed in society and the world of work.

Omar's big dream is to form his own company provding high quality electronic equipment which can be competitive and help with greater development in his country. Financial obstacles are the main obstacle to success in this.

Omar wants to say a few words to all the KIVA lenders who support him with this loan, "I am happy because of receving your help; I will not meet with any obstacle that can stop me from completing my studies. Thank you very much for the help you are offering me. I know that with that help I can become a person who improves himself. Many thanks, and I will not let you down."

loans.use: to pay costs for studying Industrial Electronics and continue becoming a specialist.

loans.name: Ranju

texts.en:
Ranju, 42, hails from a humble background in Bolangir district, Odisha, India. As a poor woman, she struggles to earn her daily cost of living through selling fish and having a small grocery shop. She has a family of three and has one son in her care. She does not have access to a toilet in her home. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Ranju is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet and install a commode in it. As she begins to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and her family's health improves, she will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide her access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install a commode in it.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita is 36 years old and has a family size of three. She is a resident of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The family, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk for infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, Babita is seeking a loan of Rs. 15,000 to build a toilet in her home. Your loan will help her family to access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home

loans.name: Gaish

texts.en:
Gaish, 48, is an entrepreneurial woman who is a resident of a neighbourhood located in the town of Bolangir, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and a grown-up son who works as a mason to earn his living. Unfortunately, Gaish does not have access to a toilet in her home and has to depend on an open field for defecation and urination.

She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a latrine so that she will no more have to compromise her privacy or be at risk of harmful communicable diseases.This will also help her to safeguard the health of her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Puran

texts.en:
Puran, 51, is a victim of the sanitation crisis in India as a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. She hails from a village in Bolangir, Odisha, India and has a family of five. She does not possess a toilet in her home but has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. She has a dire necessity to build a toilet in her home as it will increase her convenience, protect her privacy and prevent her from harmful diseases.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet in her house. It will help her get access to basic sanitation, improved health, and safety. Puran is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

Puran aspires to spread awareness among the community about the benefits of sanitation so as to promote cleanliness.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her house

loans.name: Rosa May

texts.en:
Rosa May is 40 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Rosa May is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosa May requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosa May has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 37 years old and three of her children are in school.

Gemma has a buy and sell of appliances business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like electric fans and other household product to sell for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like an electric fan and other household products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Intramuros, Philippines branch. She is 48 years old and currently running a variety store or a Sari-sari store business, “Sari-sari” is a Tagalog word which means “variety of choices”. Here you can buy grocery items by piece or by volume, kilos of rice and bottled drinks. She’s able to somehow sustain their day-to-day expenses because of the business since each month she earns PHP 15,000.

Charlita takes advantage every time CCT conducts business mentoring. They also inform members about how Kiva can help entrepreneurs who are lacking capital to sustain the business. All over the globe, there are lenders who are considerate in helping other people in need. That’s why Charlita applied for an amount of PHP 20,000 so that she’ll be able to add grocery items for her variety store business. She’s hoping that CCT will consider her application since it will be of great help if it is ever granted. She wants to thank in advance all of the lenders, CCT and Kiva.

Charlita has been consistently attending a CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This makes her become strong spiritually and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: To add grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Sat is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in the university. They are living in a rural village in Takeo province. She has been growing rice to earn an income to support her living conditions for 30 years. Moreover, she can get extra income via raising ducks. Her rice did not grow well because it was destroyed by insects. She is able to save 4 USD per day. For Sat, this is her second loan with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan completely. The previous loan helped her living conditions get better than they were before. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Accounting.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Living in Battambang province, Sokha, 42, is a farmer who has been growing rice as the main source of income for six years. Moreover, she works as a laborer for others to get more income. She is a mother of three dependent children, one of whom is in school and one is too young. She can save from her daily income about 6.5 USD per day. Lacking capital is the main challenge for her to improve her family’s business. This is the first loan for her with VisionFund and she will manage her loan to buy more fertilizer, seeds and organic pesticide to support her rice farm in order to get a good yield for her family. She hopes that her farming produces a higher yield and earns her more income to upgrade her living conditions and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to increase her crop's quality so that she can sell it for a better price in order to raise her income to support her child's studies

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is grateful that she received financial assistance numerous times in the past and never failed to pay on time. Those loans have certainly helped her T-shirt business. She finds ways and means to augment her income. Her earnings from her T-shirt sales made it possible for her to buy and sell thermal paper and chlorine.

She hopes that she can again avail a 50,000 PHP loan to pay for several packs of thermal paper and bottles of chlorine to sell. She serves the malls, and nearby restaurants that need thermal paper daily for their cash registers. There are also several orders of chlorine for household and office use as well. She praises God for your untiring support of her livelihood.

Arlene dreams of expanding her business so she can save for her child's college education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  several packs of thermal paper and chlorine to sell.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 31-year-old rural woman who lives in a small village in Bolangir, Odisha, India. She is the mother of two sons; one of them reads in grade 10 and the other one is a toddler now. She is one of the victims of the sanitation crisis of India with no access to a toilet at her home. She has to depend upon the open field, which is far away from her home to attend to nature's call.

She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a new toilet in her home. Getting access to a toilet will help her in maintaining proper hygiene and safety and thus minimize her unnecessary medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a new toilet in her home

loans.name: Suheti

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Suheti. She is a 51-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two sons. Suheti is a housewife but she and her husband also have a job, making pouch bags from cement sacks and selling them to the market. They have been doing this for 10 years and work together to increase the family income.
Suheti has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah of 5,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). This loan will be used to buy and build a water source at their home, to improve safe access to water and sanitation for their family. Currently, her income is still not enough to build toilets and a water source, but she will be able to repay the loan she receives.
Suheti and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a water source at home

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Rwanda's capital of Kigali with her three siblings. Due to her impressive academic record and high test scores, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Olga chose to attend Kepler because it offers an employment-focused curriculum. Her plan is to study Health Care Management, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, she would like to work with the UN, or possibly USAID.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Leonel Octavio

texts.es: Leonel es un emprendedor de 28 años que desde niño estuvo vinculado en la actividad comercial de su madre a quien ayudaba en la comercialización de prendas de vestir y calzado masculino.  Cuando se hizo un adolecente emprendió su propio negocio con una base de clientes del sector donde reside en un barrio del sur oriente de Barranquilla, sin embargo se consolidó mucho más a partir del año 2010.  Su oferta de productos masculina es muy variada; jeans, driles, bermudas, camisetas, suéteres, camisas y calzado para toda ocasión, los cuales vende por encargos y ofrece facilidad en su pago.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en prendas de vestir y calzado con la finalidad de aprovechar la creciente demanda a raíz de las fiestas de amor y amistad que están próximas a celebrarse y con mucha frecuencia los enamorados y amigos se regalan presentes entre sí.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su capital de trabajo, educar a sus dos hijos y adquirir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Leonel is a 28-year-old entrepreneur who, since he was a child, has been involved with his mother's business. He helped her to sell men's clothing and footwear. In his teens, Leonel started his own business with a number of customers in his local barrio in the south of Barranquilla. However, this business really started to take off from 2010.

Leonel has a very varied offering of men's clothing, selling jeans, shorts, shirts, sweatshirts, footwear for all occasions, t-shirts and other items. Leonel sells to order and offers payment facilities.

Leonel is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in clothing and footwear. He can thus respond to increased demand arising from upcoming "Love and Friendship" celebrations when lovers and friends often give each other gifts.

Leonel's future goal is to expand his working capital, raise his two children, and buy his own house.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood and fasteners to build the space for water to run away from her house and protect her family.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es: Vilma de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 20 años e inicio con capital propio, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her partner. She has made a living selling personal products for 20 years, having started the business with her own capital.

Vilma's business is located in her home but she also sells as a street vendor in different nearby areas.

Vilma is applying for a loan in order to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant and more in bulk and thus continue with her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant and more in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, de 23 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a administrar su propio negocio de venta de licuados de frutas y panes con pollo, pero también los fines de semana hace pupusas para vender, ella creció junto a sus padres quienes son  personas muy humildes y trabajadoras, que se dedicaban a la venta de frutas y verduras, está acompañada y solo estudio hasta bachillerato. 

Ana, tiene 5 años de vender licuados, panes y pupusas, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, este negocio se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y es de las ganancias que cubre las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para ampliar el negocio de licuados y panes y además comprará productos de la canasta básica para colocar una tienda, porque en el sector donde vive, la única tienda se encuentra a 1 kilómetro y por esa razón ha dicididó junto a su pareja colocar la tienda. 

Las sueños y metas de Ana, son mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 23 years old. She takes care of the household chores at home, and manages her own business where she sells fruit smoothies, and chicken sandwiches. At the weekend, she also makes "pupusas" (tortillas stuffed with cheese and rice and meat, chicken or beans) to sell. Ana grew up with her parents, who were very poor and hard-working. They made a living selling fruits and vegetables. Ana has a partner and only completed high school.

Ana has been selling smoothies, breads and pupusas for five years. She learned the trade from her parents, and the business has become her main source of income; profits from it cover household necessities.

This loan will be used to expand Ana's business selling smoothies and breads, and to buy staple goods to open a shop. She is opening a shop as where she lives the only shop is one kilometre away. She has decided to open the shop with her partner.

Ana's dreams and goals are to improve conditions in her home and at her business.

loans.use: to expand her business selling smoothies and breads, and to buy staple goods to open a shop.

loans.name: Minina

texts.en:
Minina is 48 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Minina works very hard to provide for them.

Minina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

Minina has been in this business for 7 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Glenda is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Glenda has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a first-year student at Kepler. He was raised in a small rural village by his grandmother. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from among 6,000 applicants this year. Emmanuel chose Kepler because of its academic rigor and the reputation of its business curriculum.

Emmanuel plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to become an entrepreneur. At Kepler, Emmanuel plans to develop his critical thinking and communications skills.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Mayrose

texts.en:
Mayrose is 31 years old, married with two children.

Mayrose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

Mayrose has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from weaving.

Mayrose aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 50 years old and has five children. Gemma is married and has one child in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kuni

texts.en:
Kuni, 40 is a resident of a small remote village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She has a family of four. The area where she lives does not have a good source of drinking water and she has to travel a long distance to a river to get water for her consumption and household purposes. She does not find it feasible to travel daily in order to get water.

Therefore she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to install a hand pump in her house so that she can easily get the water for her use. This loan amount will increase her convenience and prevent her from harmful water-borne diseases. She is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to install a hand pump.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita is a married woman, 65 years old with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Merita has a business buying and selling sticky rice in the Philippines. Merita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy rice and sticky rice to sell.

Merita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and sticky rice to sell.

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is a bright student. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. He is living in a village with his family. He is single. He graduated high school and entered university this year.

He studies full time in a department. He wants to be a professional pharmacist. He likes to study and be active in his classes. He has not got enough money to pay for his higher education costs.

He appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for financial support to pay his tuition fees. He awaits your kindness and support. He hopes to get knowledge and learn enough to be helpful for society.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for mobile phone credit and to buy women's clothes to be sold to peers nearby.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 37 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 54 years old and married with five children.

She is in an agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 49 years old and has five children. Elisa is a married woman.

Elisa is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elisa has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rebecca is 49 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Rebecca has a pottery making business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and has seven children. Through her income from her iron works business, she is able to provide her children with necessities.

Rebecca offers made-to-order roll-up doors, steel windows, and grills. Her husband is her partner in running the business. They have been 10 years in this business.

Rebecca wanted to expand her business for additional income too. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy iron bars, and other materials for making windows, and doors. She hopes for continuous growth of her business for their future.

loans.use: to buy iron bars, and other materials for making windows and doors.

loans.name: Bariaa

texts.en: Bariaa is a single lady who’s 39 years old and works hard to support her family after her father’s death. She used to be a nurse until she decided to start her own business, which is more comfortable in regards of work schedule. Four years ago, she opened a shop to sell home ornaments and detergents. In order for her to increase the items in her shop and to diversify and expand her business, Bariaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. Bariaa also hopes to start another new business (selling mobiles) at a later stage.

loans.use: to increase the items in her shop and to diversify and expand her business.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 32 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Shiela works very hard to provide for them.

Shiela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

Shiela has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

loans.name: Beverly Joy

texts.en:
Beverly Joy is 28 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Beverly Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Beverly Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Beverly Joy has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, junk foods, candies, coffee, soap and other groceries.

In the future, Beverly Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Alimaya

texts.en:
Ma. Alimaya is 36 years old and single.

Ma. Alimaya works hard to provide for her daily needs. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Ma. Alimaya has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from meat vending.

Ma. Alimaya aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Bewila

texts.en:
Bewila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bewila is 46 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Bewila has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Bewila requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell.

Bewila has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
A loan of $ 600 will help Jose to send his son to University. He hopes that by continuing his son's education, they will have more opportunities and a better life.

The money will be used to cover educational costs including tuition, books, school supplies and school registration.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, books, school supplies and school registration.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her nimbler grass.

loans.name: Veronica Liceth

texts.es:
Veronica es una mujer joven y emprendedora es madre soltera tiene 22 años tiene un niño de 3 años quien es el motor para inspirarle a que trabaje por sacarle adelante.

ella se dedica a los quehaceres domesticos pero ella necesita el dinero para comprar gallinas y balanceado y empezar el negocios de venta de pollos en el lugar donde ella vive existen personas que les gusta mucho comer pollo por eso ella dice que es un buen negocios.

El sueño de ella es poner ternimar los estudios ya que por el niño no lo pudo hacer. En los tiempos libres disfruta mucho ver la television con sus hijos sobre todo los dibujos.
texts.en:
Veronica, 22, is a young and self-starting woman. She is a single mother to a three year old son who inspires her to work to support him.


She makes a living doing domestic tasks but she needs money to buy chickens and feed to start her chicken selling business. Many people who live in her area enjoy eating chicken, which is why she says this is a good business.

Her dream is to finish school, since she was not able to continue due to becoming a mother. In her free time she enjoys watching TV with her son, especially cartoons.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Karla Lissette

texts.es:
Karla, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, desde pequeña junto a su madre se han dedicado al comercio, está soltera y tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en una parada de buses en la ciudad.

Karla, desde que su madre falleció hace un año solo ella administra el negocio y vive en casa familiar.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar más frutas y verduras para su negocio y el resto del dinero será para comprar material para arreglar la tumba de su madre.

El sueño de Karla, es seguir trabajando con su negocio y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Karla is 39 years old. She went to school until the 2nd grade. From when she was little, she and her mother have worked in business together. She is single and has a business selling fruits and vegetables in a bus stop in the city.

Since her mother passed away a year ago, Karla manages the business alone and lives in the family house.

The loan will be used to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business and the rest of the money will be used to buy material to sort out her mother's grave. Karla's dream is to keep working with her business and that her business grows.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Con 41 años de edad Berta ha logrado tener su propia vivienda en la que habita junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 5 años de edad. Berta siempre buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia decidió hace 15 años dedicarse a la compra y venta de trapeadores de toalla, pero además compra retazo de tela para hacer otra clase de trapeadores, obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos. El piso de la vivienda de Berta es de tierra y está causando enfermedades respiratorias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y una puerta para encementar el piso e instalar una puerta en su vivienda y de esta manera proteger a su familia y cuidar de la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Berta is 41 years old and has managed to have her own home where she lives with her partner and her 5-year old daughter. Berta is always looking for a way to support her family, so 15 years ago she decided to make a living buying and selling towel mops. She also buys pieces of cloth to make a different kind of mop, and thus getting a better income.

The floor in Berta's house is dirt and it is causing respiratory illness, so she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, and a door to concrete the floor and install a door in her house. This way she can protect her family and take care of their health.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and a door to concrete the floor and install a door in her house.

loans.name: Jose Santana

texts.es:
José, de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está casado, su esposa trabaja como profesora en una escuela cercana y no tienen hijos.

José, está jubilado de una empresa de telecomunicaciones, en ese lugar trabajó treinta y dos años, ahora recibe una pensión y obtiene ingresos por alquilar unos cuartos de su casa.
 
José, necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su vehículo, porque es el medio que utiliza para hacer viajes y obtener ingresos para él y su esposa. 

José, desea seguir trabajando para cubrir las necesidades de él y su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 67 years old. He went to school until the 3rd year of high school. He is married and his wife works as a teacher in a nearby school, and they do not have any children. José is retired from a telecommunications company where he worked for 32 years. Now he receives a pension and gets an income from renting out rooms in his house.

José needs the loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle. He uses his vehicle to make trips and get an income for himself and his wife. José hopes to keep working to cover his and his wife's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín es un hombre de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos dos varones de 17 y 18 años y dos hijas una mayor de edad y una niña de 7 años de edad. Efraín se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa cercana  a su vivienda, además su compañera de vida le apoya gracias a su negocio de venta de productos. Efraín desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Efraín is a 44-year old man who lives with his wife and 4 children. He has two boys ages 17 and 18, and two daughters, one of which is an adult and the other one is 7 years old. Efraín works in a company near his house. His wife also supports him thanks to her business selling products.

Efraín wants to change the roof on his home because it is deteriorated. He is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to change his home's roof, thus improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to change his home's roof, thus improving his quality of life.

loans.name: Anna

texts.es:
Anna tiene 53 años de edad, casada, con un hijo dependiente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo en el Distrito de Pucara, en la provincia de Jaén, Region Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Anna es la del comercio de café (compra /venta), el compra dicho productos a los agricultores de la zona para luego llevarlos a venderlos a la ciudad de Jaen, se dedica a dicha actividad hace más de 08 años, por lo que cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro, y buenas referencias personales y laborales, ademas se dedica a brindar servicio de corte y confeccion, cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura en su propio domicilio, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales ,el préstamo lo utilizará en el negocio de comercio de cafe, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para comercializar, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos y pópdrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Anna is 53 years old. She is married and has a dependent son. She lives in her own house with her husband, in the district of Pucara, province of Jaen, Region of Cajamarca, northern mountains of Peru. Anna works in coffee commerce (buying and selling). She buys this product from farmers in the region in order to sell it later in the city of Jaen. She has worked in this job for more than 8 years and because of it, she has a lot of experience in the business and good personal and work references. She also works as a seamstress. She has a small sewing workshop in her house and has very good personal references. She will use the loan for her coffee business. She will buy more quantity of merchandise to sell. This way, she will generate more income and will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Odila Del Carmen

texts.es: Odilia de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso domestico desde hace 10 años e inicio con capital propio, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas prodcutos (ollas, vasos, perfumes, vajillas, etc.) por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Odilia is 34 years old. She lives in her own house with her family. She has worked for 10 years selling domestic products. She started her business with her own capital. With her sales, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more products (pots, glasses, perfumes, dishes, etc.) at wholesale prices in order to continue with her sales and have better financial income.

loans.use: to buy more products (pots, glasses, perfumes, dishes, etc.) at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her motorcycle transport business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing and to buy maize seeds to plant in order to meet her clients’ demands, which have increased in the market and within families.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 31 years old and has six children, all of whom are in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cristina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman, 49 years old, with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mercedita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Mercedita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 34 years old and she has one child.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Emelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, salts, and other groceries.

Emelia has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan.

Emelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, salts, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lilia Esther

texts.es: Lilia es una ama de casa de 72 años de edad, residenciada en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y madre de tres hijos mayores de edad, su espíritu emprendedor le permitió asumir nuevas experiencias entre ellas salir de lo cotidiano para convertirse en una empresaria independiente por medio de la venta de mercancías, su hija le sugirió incorporarse en la distribución masiva de productos por intermedio de catálogos especializados en artículos de cuidado personal.  Hoy en día cuenta con cinco años en esta actividad que es un medio de ingresos adicionales para su familia y hace más dinámico vivir.
