Sus clientes habitualmente le compran splash, cremas corporales y perfumadas, productos capilares y prendas de vestir, sin embargo su capital no le es suficiente para responder a los pedidos, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo e invertir en prendas de vestir, cosméticos y cremas corporales. Esta inversión mejorará los tiempos de entrega de sus pedidos y la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas.  Su meta a futuro es duplicar sus ventas y conseguir nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 72-year-old homemaker and mother of three grown children. She lives in a neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. Her entrepreneurial spirit has allowed her to gain new experiences, among them to break out of the daily routine to become an independent business owner who sells merchandise. Her daughter suggested that she sign up to be a distributor of personal care items sold through specialized catalogs.

Today Lilia has five years of experience in this business, which is a source of extra income that helps her create a more positive life for her family. Her customers regularly buy splash, body creams, perfumes, hair care products, and articles of clothing. Nevertheless, her current capital isn't sufficient to fill all of her orders, so she is applying for her first loan though the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that she can buy clothing items, cosmetics, and body creams. This investment will improve her ability to fill her orders quickly and give her the opportunity to increase her sales. Her goal for the future is to double her sales and to gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing, cosmetics, and body creams.

loans.name: Gabriela Antonia

texts.es:
Gabriela, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo está fuera del país desde hace tres años, junto él ha procreado tres hijos, de los cuales  solo uno vive con ella, porque su otro hijo vive con su abuela desde hace cuatro años, porque la escuela está más cerca donde la abuela.

Gabriela, se dedica al comercio de frutas, este negocio se lo enseñaron las tías, porque se dedican a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo; pero Antonia también trabaja en el campo junto a sus tías, esta actividad la realiza desde hace dos años y se levanta a las 6:00 de la mañana para ir al campo a preparar la tierra para sembrar y trabaja hasta las 11:00 a.m. 

Gabriela, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro sacos de abono, dos para el frijol y dos para el maíz, también comprará semilla para sembrar.

Los sueños de Gabriela, son seguir ayudando a sus tías y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 27 years old, studied up to ninth grade. She is married; her husband has been out of the country for three years. With him, she has procreated three children, of whom only one lives with her because her other son has been living with his grandmother for four years now since the school is closer to the grandmother's.

Gabriela makes a living in fruit sales. She was taught this business by her aunts because they have been in this occupation for a long time, but Gabriela Antonia also works in the field with her aunts. She has been carrying out this occupation for two years now and gets up at 6:00 am to go to the field to prepare the land for planting and works until 11:00 am.

Gabriela needs the loan to buy four bags of manure; two for beans and two for corn. She will also buy seeds for planting.

Gabriela's dreams are to continue helping her aunts and get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy four bags of manure (two for beans and two for corn) and seeds for planting.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María, de 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es madre soltera, se separó de su esposo hace 19 años, en ese matrimonio procreó 4 hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive con ella.

María, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 21 años de edad, antes ella trabajaba con el papá, pero cuando se casó, continúo trabajando con su esposo, después que se separó de su esposo ella siguió trabajando con sus hijos.- María, además de la agricultura, también se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella compra los árboles de aguacate por cosecha y luego cuando tiene frutos, sale a vender aguacates. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para alquilar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno para cultivarlo y para comprar herbicidas, pesticidas y semilla de maíz, ya que está vez cultivará solo lo necesario, porque el tiempo de la lluvia no es estable. 

María, espera que este año puedan obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is a single mother; she separated from her husband 19 years ago. From that marriage, she had four children, only one of which lives with her.

María has worked in agriculture since she was 21 years old. At first, she worked with her father. Once she got married, she continued working with her husband. After separating, she continued working with her children. Beside agriculture, María also sells fruits and vegetables. She buys avocado plants to be harvested and when the fruit is ready, she goes out to sell it. 

She is requesting a loan to lease 7,000 square meters of land for farming and to buy herbicides, pesticides and corn seed. This time she will only grow the bare minimum because the raining season is not stable. 

Maria hopes to have a good harvest this year.

loans.use: to lease 7,000 square meters of land for farming and to buy herbicides, pesticides and corn seed.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma, 45, is a humble, enterprising and industrious lady from a village of Bolangir, Odisha, India.

The area where she resides does not have a clean water source and many people in that area are affected by harmful water-borne diseases. Uma travels a long distance in order to bring clean water for her use every day.

She is requesting for a loan amount of 15,000 INR to install a hand pump and incorporate water pipes so as to facilitate the supply of water. This will help her get access to clean water and maintain her safety against harmful diseases. Uma is in dire need of your help and support.

loans.use: to install a hand pump and incorporate water pipes.

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 25 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maria is 40 years old and lives with her son in a house she owns. She's been in the business of selling clothes for the last 25 years. She has a stand in the municipal market and she has a lot of clients. With the money she earns she has been able to cover the expenses of her home. She is requesting a loan to  buy more clothes wholesale to be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius used a previous loan to buy soap, sugar, and sewing materials for his businesses. He offers a tailoring service, in addition to his main retail business, which he operates five days a week.

Julius's main aim is to earn more income and sustain his family. He is faced with a problem of limited capital, which limits him from expanding his business. However, Julius looks forward to opening a new shop as a way of obtaining more profits. Julius needs a loan to buy materials for sewing.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lucila Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucila vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 6 años ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, tiene muchos clientes pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in her own home with her family and has run a beauty salon business for 6 years which is located near her home in a busy area. She has many customers, due to the quality of her work, and with the earnings she manages to cover the household costs.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her salon such as creams, shampoo, hair clips and scissors amongst other things that she needs. This way she can improve her profits and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy products for her salon such as creams, shampoo, hair clips and scissors amongst other things.

loans.name: Roberto Alfonso

texts.es: Roberto es un hombre de 52 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre a la que quiere mucho y siempre busca la manera de apoyarla. Roberto cuenta con un taller de estructuras metálicas, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, además los fines de semana se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado bovino, lo que le permite obtener ingresos extra. Roberto desea terminar de construir la pared de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía solo tiene una parte, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava para terminar de construir la pared de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 52-year-old man. He lives in a house of his own with his mother whom he loves very much and is always looking for a way to support her. Roberto has a metal structures workshop, a business that allows him to maintain the economy of his home. Plus, on weekends, he buys and sells cattle, which allows him to earn extra income.

Roberto wishes to finish building the wall of his home because, as seen in the photograph, it has only one part, reason why he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sand, and gravel to finish building the wall of his home.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, and gravel to finish building the wall of his home.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline sells frozen foods while caring for her three children. She goes around their village just to vend all her products every day.

Evangeline is 49 years of age, and she has three children whom she is sending to school. Her husband is a farmer. Through their respective sources of income, they are able to feed their children.

Evangeline wants to sell more products so that she can earn a bigger income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy hot dogs, ham, sausage, and many more items.

Evangeline believes that by having the loan, she could buy more products to sell and gain greater profits.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, ham, sausage, and many more items.

loans.name: Lisel

texts.en:
Lisel is 40 years old and married. She has four children and three of them are still in school. Lisel works very hard to provide for them.

Lisel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snacks foods.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snacks foods.

loans.name: Time

texts.en:
Time is a single woman who has no children. Time owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.

Time operates a fuel selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase more fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fuel for resale.

loans.name: Phonsee Group

texts.en:
Sone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Sone and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Sone is excited that the water filter is available on an affordable payment plan.

Sone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. After totaling up the costs, Sone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings that the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 53-year-old married man, living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like coffee, bananas and carrots.

He started his projects in 2005, with an aim of raising an income for his family. The income from these businesses was used to pay back a previous loan, and to pay the school fees of his children.

Charles faces the challenge of unreliable market prices that affect his income projections. However, he is looking forward to educating his children to higher levels of learning.

Charles now needs a loan to pay for the labor of those working in his coffee plantation and also for herbicides to spray the carrots.

loans.use: to pay for labour to those working in his coffee plantation and herbicides to spray carrots

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a merchant living in the town of Pilar on Bohol in the Philippines. She operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling basic household merchandise like catsup, cooking oil, soy sauce, canned goods, powdered soap, biscuits, soft drinks and school supplies.

Hilda is a 37-year-old married woman with four children. Her eldest child is 14 while the youngest is four. Her husband has an income that helps to cater for the family's daily needs.

Hilda has requested a loan to buy supplies for the store such as noodles, soft drinks, beverages and dry goods. These will help her maintain her store's stocks and enable her to cater for the orders of her customers. In this way, she will be able to provide her family with good food and continue supporting her children's schooling.

In the future, she hopes that she will be able to successfully manage her source of income for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass, to meet increased demand, and use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es: Mario de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la pesca artesanal e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de redes, trasmallos y darle mantenimiento a la lancha para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Mario, age 44, lives in his own home with his wife and child. For 15 years, he has been a traditional fisherman. He started with his own capital and sells his products in different markets near his home. With his income, he is able to get ahead. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of nets and driftnets, and to repair his boat so that he can continue with this work, as it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy nets and driftnets, and to repair his boat.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad vive en casa propia con compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de cocos y agua de coco desde hace 5 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: This young man, whose face is pixelated because he is 26, lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has been selling coconut and coconut water for five years. His business is located in his home and he has many clients. With his sales, he is able to get ahead. He is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of more coconut in order to continue with his sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy coconut wholesale.

loans.name: Ygnacia

texts.es:
Ygnacia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en una zona rural del distrito de Olmos que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ygnacia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 7 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Ygnacia espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ygnacia is 51, married, and lives with her husband in a rural district of Olmos, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The residents of this district work mainly in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.
Ygnacia raises and sells small animals like chickens, hens, and ducks. Her business is located in her home. She has seven years' experience with the business and has very good personal and work references in the area. She will use this loan for the purchase of more animals like hens, chickens, and ducks. She will also purchase balanced feed for the animals. Ygnacia hopes to offer a better product to her clients, which will allow her to generate more income, increasing her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of nine children, Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling personal care products. Ma. Teresa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, like sugar, oil, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ma. Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 43 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school. Lorena works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 35,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

Lorena has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. He grew up with his six siblings in Rwanda's capital, Kigali. Because of his exceptional academic record and dedication, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Fred chose Kepler because it offers exposure to challenging internships to develop job skills and a professional network as you learn.

Fred plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he would like to pursue a degree in law or an MBA. Fred believes his greatest strengths are his work ethic and discipline, two traits that will serve him well at Kepler.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Manilyn is 19 years old now.

Manilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Manilyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 27 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo, and snack foods.

Aiza has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo, and snack foods.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografia para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Milagro, age 50, lives in her own home with her husband. She has planted corn and beans for 20 years. She sells her products in the various markets near her home and is requesting a new loan for the purchase of fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc as shown in the photo. This is so that she may have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marilyn is borrowing 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending, such as spices, vegetables and fish.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Bella Fe

texts.en:
Bella Fe works hard to support her family. She is single and has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines.

Bella Fe has requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell from her stall. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from renting out motorcycles.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Razel works hard to support her family.

She has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from bicycle transport. Razel is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming vegetable business.

Razel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Heuyphet Group

texts.en:
Noy’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Noy and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Noy and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, and within these 2 years, filter users like Noy’s family will identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cake ingredients and boxes of beverages.

loans.name: Febrien

texts.en:
Febrien is married with three children and she lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

She works hard selling food like bananas, and gets additional income from growing cocoa. She is involved in the businesses in order to earn income and to meet her family's basic needs. The main customers that she serves are local people.

She is challenged by competition and limited capital, which hinders her future prospects of expanding her business and of buying land to grow more cocoa.

Febrien has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa to resell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Flordelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Flordelle works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell school supplies business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Flordelle is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of school supplies to sell to her stall.

Flordelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of school supplies to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Mata

texts.en:
Mata is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Twaranyuzwe Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice  fait partie du groupe  Twaranyuzwe et  habite à Ngozi. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Félicien, un enseignant. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 8mois à 4 ans. 


Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane   depuis  6 ans. 


Elle est à son troisième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de banane pour préparer de  la bière  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Beatrice is a member of the Twaranyuzwe group and lives in Ngozi. She is 32 years old and is married to Felicien, a teacher. Together, they have two children, aged 8 months and four years old.

Beatrice has been making banana beer for six years. She is on her third loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large amount of bananas. She will make the bananas into beer, sell it, and earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of bananas to make beer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN QUE TRABAJA PARA MANTENER SUS ESTUDIOS. SUFRE DE MAL ALINEAMIENTO EN SUS DIENTES, ESTO LE CAUSA PENA ENTRE SUS COMPAÑEROS DE TRABAJO, NECESITA DE UN TRATAMIENTO DE ORTODONCIA QUE LE AYUDE A SOLUCIONAR SU PROBLEMA, SIN EMBARGO ESTE LE RESULTA COSTOSO PARA SU ECONOMÍA YA QUE ELLA ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
This young woman works in order to support her studies. She suffers from misalignment of her teeth. This embarrasses her with her work colleagues.

She needs orthodontic treatment that will help her to solve her problem. However, this is expensive, and she is the sole support of her family.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 39-year-old married mother of two children. Two years ago, she opened her cereals shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is responsible of her children, after her husband traveled outside Lebanon seeking a better salary.

Salam is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to diversify her merchandise with new cereals to satisfy her customers' special requests.

Salam hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to diversify her merchandise with new cereals to satisfy her customers' special requests

loans.name: Triunfando Juntos Group

texts.es:
El Grupo solidario ¨triunfando juntos¨, se juntaron para sumar la responsabilidad de un crédito para el mejoramiento de sus vidas. La coordinadora del grupo es María Auxiliadora, de 64 años dedicándose a la venta de productos varios como pan, aguacate, plátano de manera ambulante en su comunidad. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a esta actividad junto con el apoyo de su compañero, y ahora mantiene a su responsabilidad un hijo de 13 años, del cual se dedica a que tengas todos sus derechos para salir adelante. Por segunda vez están solicitando crédito para la compra de yuca, plátano, aguacate y compra de pan.  
Las otras socias son María, de 34 años, quien también tiene una mini pulpería y vende ropa. Y Damaris quien también posee una pulpería en su hogar desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The Trianfando Juntos communal bank got together in order to assume the responsibilities of a loan to improve their lives.

María Auxiliadora, age 64, is the coordinator of the group. She sells various products like bread, avocados, and bananas in an itinerant manner in her community. She has been engaged in this business activity with the support of her friend for ten years. She now has the responsibility of supporting a 13 year old son. She devotes herself to seeing that he has all that he deserves in order to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan for the second time to buy cassava, bananas, avocados, and bread.

María, age 34, who has a mini grocery store and sells clothes, is another member. Damaris, the other member, has had a grocery store at her home for five years.

loans.use: to buy cassava, bananas, avocados, and bread.

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
Asha is in her late 30s and is married with six children. Five of them are still in school and one is still small. She has been selling fried fish for ten years now. She works from 08am to 04pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Asha's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her fish stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group, which is doing great in their business and in their families' education and welfare. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loans, to buy a plot of land, built her house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on fish stock, to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of owning a beauty salon.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group Tunaweza which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on fish stock, to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Azmi

texts.en:
Azmi is a 19-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.

Azmi is a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to take his BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses.

Azmi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Azmi will be able to do his home work and reports easily. Azmi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help him achieve his BA in Business Administration

loans.name: Sokra's Group

texts.en: Sokra’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokra makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Sitha is 35 years old and married with three dependent children. Two of her children are still in school while the other one is too young to attend school. Earning about 13 USD and saving approximately about 6 USD, Sitha is growing rice as her main source of income. Her husband drives a taxi for additional income.

A lack of working capital is the main challenge to the rice growing business. She is now leading a two-member group to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Sitha will use her loan to sustain her rice growing business by purchasing rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. with the leftover loan portion she will use pay for plowing fees.

Sitha hopes to earn more income so as to upgrade their living standards and especially to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve her farmland and increase her income to support her children's education.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es viuda tiene 72 años de edad. Trabaja en una tienda de conveniencia empacando el mandado de lo cual ella recibe propinas aparte recibe una pensión mensual por viudez la cual es muy poca. Desde hace cuatro años padece cataratas, mismas que necesitan ser operadas ya que esta perdiendo su vista y esto la imposibilita para trabajar.
texts.en:
She is a 72 year old widow. She works at a convenience store packing orders for which she receives tips. She also gets a monthly widow's pension, which is not very much.

She has had cataracts for four years. They need to be operated on because she is losing her vision. This will make it impossible for her to work.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Palingwende Group

texts.fr:
Marie est une femme âgée de 32 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants. 

Elle exerce son activité de vendeuse de pagnes et chaussures depuis 5 ans. 

Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est le respect des clients, l’écoute, et la prière demandant la grâce de Dieu dans son commerce. 

Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des pagnes pour 400 000 f ; des chaussures pour 200 000 f ; des sacs à mains pour 100 000 f ; des mèches pour 100 000 f et du savon pour 100 000f. 

L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner son commerce afin de renforcer son activité. 

Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Marie is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has worked selling pagnes [bright, colorful cloth] and shoes for five years. She is successful because of her customers' respect, [her ability to] listen, and her prayers asking for the grace of God to help her with her business.

Marie wants this loan to buy pagnes for 400,000 francs CFA, shoes for 200,000 francs CFA, handbags for 100,000 francs CFA, hair extensions for 100,000 francs CFA, and soap for 100,000 francs CFA.
This stock will help to strengthen her business.

Marie has already received loans several times, and she has repaid them all on time.

loans.use: to buy, among other things, pagnes [bright, colorful cloth], damask fabric, and a basket of shoes.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 31-year-old married mother of three. She started, five years ago, working in a nursery to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She loves children as much as she loves her job.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will help her move to her work in an easy way. Zainab hopes to get a promotion in her work as she hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car which will help her move to her work easily.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a restaurant for the last 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a large hotel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elvie dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jovelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Abdulkadir

texts.en: Abdulkadir is a Babban Gona farmer from Gabas Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Abdulkadir no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably.  This season Abdulkadir has ambitious plans to harvest 35 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulkadir now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de trois enfants, Akouvi prépare du riz qu’elle revend à  la devanture de son domicile. Akouvi s’approvisionne du nécessaire six fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander le sac de riz, des tas de condiments.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akouvi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 28 years old, married, and lives in Tokoin. A mother of three children, she prepares rice which she resells from the front of her home.

Akouvi procures her ingredients six times a month at the market, and she seeks this loan to order a sac of rice and piles of condiments.

With the profits she earns, Akouvi hopes to improve her business and help her children develop and receive an education.

loans.use: to buy one sac of rice and two piles of condiments.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda works hard to support her family. Emelda is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Emelda has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Emelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Alexander Alberto

texts.es: Alexander de 27 años es un joven que emprendió su propio negocio de ferretería en el sector donde reside al sur de Barranquilla.  La carencia de este formato de negocio en su comunidad le permitió proporcionarle a los habitantes del sector un establecimiento en donde puedieran encontrar un variado surtido de herramientas y objetos necesarios en la carpintería y reparaciones eléctricas entre ellos clavos, tornillos, alambres, cerraduras, enchufes, pinturas, disolventes, brochas y demás.  Diariamente los residentes y transeúntes del lugar visitan su ferretería, la cual está abierta a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. un horario extenso para que puedan realizar sus compras.  Alexander aprovecho la afluencia de personas que ingresan en su negocio y surtió con golosinas y mecatos con la finalidad de tener una ganancia extra.   Hoy en día está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en surtido para su ferretería puesto que tan solo cuenta con un año de funcionamiento y su capital le es insuficiente para tener una mayor variedad en su negocio.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su gama de artículos y comprar su propio apartamento.
texts.en:
Alexander is 27 years old, and he started his own hardware store south of Barranquilla in the area where he lives. The lack of this type of business in his community enabled him to provide the residents of the area with a place where they can find a variety of tools and other items necessary for carpentry and electrical repairs such as nails, screws, wire, locks, plugs, paint, solvents, brushes, and more.

Residents and people passing through the area visit his hardware store everyday. His store has extensive business hours from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m., so that they are able to make their purchases. Alexander takes advantage of the flow of people into his business by stocking his store with sweets and pastries to earn extra money.

Today, he is applying for a credikiva, the first financing he has done with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the credikiva, he will use it to buy supplies for his hardware store. His store has only been operating for one year, and his capital is insufficient to have a greater variety of products. His future goal is to expand his range of products and buy his own apartment.

loans.use: to stock his hardware store inventory.

loans.name: David

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, David est un homme qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 22 ans, David se bat pour gagner sa vie en conduisant un taxi moto dans la ville de Lomé. Pour s’approvisionner du carburant frelaté servant au démarrage de sa moto, David se rend chez son fournisseur deux fois par mois. David sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bidons d’essences frelatés en vue d’être à jour et de maximiser son profit afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie déplorables.
texts.en:
Single with no children, David is 22 years old and lives in Tokoin. He works hard each day to earn a living by driving a taxi motorcycle in Lome.

David buys low-quality fuel for his motorcycle twice a month. He is seeking this loan to order drums of fuel, with the hopes of maximizing his profits and improving his low quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four drums of low-quality petrol.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en: Orn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Orn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Afi Dzito

texts.fr: Agée de 22 ans, Afi est une femme célibataire et sans enfant vivant à Tokoin.  Pour soutenir sa famille, Afi est une tresseuse qui vend des mèches et tissages dans son salon de coiffure en s’approvisionnant quatre fois par mois au marché. Afi réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Afi désire ce prêt pour commander des champoing et  tissages afin d’agrandir son stock et aider sa famille à couvrir les besoins quotidiens et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Afi is 22 years old, single, and has no children. She lives in Tokoin. To support her family, Afi works braiding hair and selling hair extensions and weaves in her hair salon. She procures her stock four times a month at the market.

Afi earns a living with this work. As a way to satisfy her customers, Afi is seeking this loan to increase her stock of shampoo and weaves. She wants to help her family support their daily needs and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of shampoo and two dozen weaves.

loans.name: Davë

texts.en:
Davë and her husband are parents of five, with the youngest one being 19 years old. They live with four of their kids and the mother-in-law, squeezed in a very small hutch covered with carton. As you can see, they're very poor.

Years ago Davë gave birth to twins; one of them passed way right after the birth and the other twin sister was immediately diagnosed with a physical disease that she's been carrying since then.

This is the reason why Davë needs your compassion and financial help through a loan in an amount of 60,000 ALL (Albanian Lek). Davë works for wages of $250/month while her daughter receives a monthly disability income of $99 and her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension of $115/month.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's medical needs

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr: Beatrice est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Agée de 45 ans, Beatrice est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des sacs de friperies à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour bien atteindre ses objectifs, Beatrice s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de sacs de sorties et d’écoliers afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire des enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Beatrice is married and lives in Tokoin with her four children. Forty-five years old, she is a dynamic and brave woman. She works to earn a living by selling used bags from her home and sometimes by traveling around different areas.

To achieve her goals, Beatrice procures stock twice a month from the market. She is seeking this loan to finance her business and order bags of different types, including school bags. Earnings will support her daily needs and help her husband pay their children's school fees next time.

loans.use: to buy two orders of school bags and seven orders of different types of bags.

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y carteras desde hace 5 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más lociones, cosméticos, perfumes, carteras, cremas, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luisa is 45 years old and lives with her partner and their daughter, she has earned a living selling personal products and handbags for 5 years. 

Her business is located in the main market in a very visited zone, therefore she gets a lot of clients. 

With her earnings she manages to cover some of the expenses of her home. 

She is asking for a new loan to be able to buy more to buy more lotions, cosmetics, perfumes, handbags, creams etc. all in wholesale, to be able to continue selling which will earn her a good income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more lotions, cosmetics, perfumes, handbags, creams etc. all in wholesale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 47 years old and married with seven children, three of whom in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Marites has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María, de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, solo tiene una hija, que ya se casó, en su casa solo vive con dos nietas y una sobrina.

María, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que era una joven, su padre siempre la llevaba a trabajar al campo porque era la única fuente de ingresos que ellos tenían como familia, pero después que se embarazó se le hacía difícil trabajar en la agricultura, porque tenía que cuidar a su hija; fue por esa razón que con esfuerzo logró colocar una venta de frutas y de esa manera saco adelante su hija; ella no ha dejado de cultivar la tierra a pesar de su edad y actualmente quiere sembrar.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para preparar la tierra y sembrar frijoles, porque las milpas de este invierno se secaron, ahora intentará sembrar frijoles.
   
Los mayores deseos de María, son seguir cultivando la tierra y que las nietas puedan seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old, and she studied until eighth grade in school. She has one daughter who is already married. She only lives with her two granddaughters and niece in her home.

María has made a living in agriculture since she was young. Her father always used to bring her to work in the countryside because that was the only source of income that the family had. However, after she became pregnant, it was difficult for her to work in agriculture because she had to care for her daughter. It was for this reason that with much effort she managed to get a place to sell fruit, and she took care of her daughter through this. She hasn't stopped farming the land in spite of her age, and she currently has the desire to plant.

María needs a loan to buy manure and fertilizer to prepare her land and plant beans. The cornfields from this winter have dried, so now she will try to plant beans. María's desires to continue farming the land, and she desires that her granddaughters continue studying.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to prepare her land and plant beans.

loans.name: Phoin's Group

texts.en:
Phoin has had a cassava farm for ten years and this is her main income source in her family. Moreover, she can earn more income via rice cropping. Phoin is 28 years old and a mother of one child. Nowadays, she is living in Kampong Cham province. Her cassavas did not grow well last season because it was destroyed by insects. She can save about 4.5USD per day from her current businesses. She has been with VisionFund for 5 cycles already and her family’s living is getting better than before with her previous loans.

Phoin is a group leader of two members in seeking a new loan. She will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer and cassava seed support on her farmland to make her cassava grow well. She hopes that she can get better yields from her cassava farm to increase her family’s income and she can keep her child at school as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava seed to grow a good crop so that she can increase her income to keep for future need.

loans.name: Colirios Group

texts.es: El grupo colirio, ha demostrado estar conformados por 4 miembros responsables, y dispuestos a salir adelante para el bienestar de sus familias, coordinado por Rosa de 26 años casada y con hijos de edades 8 y 3 años.  Instaló en su casa, una mini pulpería para poder sacarles pequeñas ganancias que le ayudara a pagar los gastos familiares. Desde 1 ½ tiene su negocio, ahora requiere invertir en la compra de productos de mayor consumo, como gaseosas, ropas, golosinas y helados. Así podrá aumentar la visita de sus clientes a su negocio.  Las demas socias son Patricia del Carmen, dedicada a la elaboración manual de piñatas, flores y coronas para ocasiones especiales.  Patricia de los Ángeles de 23 años tiene una pulperia y también se dedica a la preparación y ventas de comidas. Lizbeth, maneja su pulperia y vende cosméticos. Proporcionándoles mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The Colirio Group has demonstrated that it is made up of 4 members who are responsible, and ready to get ahead for the well-being of their families. The group is coordinated by Rosa who is 26 years old, and married with children who are 8 and 3 years old.

Rosa began a small grocery store in her home in order to earn a little money to help her pay for the household expenses. She has had her business for one and a half years, and now it's necessary to invest in the purchase of highly consumed products such as soda, clothes, sweets, and ice cream. By doing this, her clients will visit her store more frequently.

Another member of the group is Patricia del Carmen, who makes handmade piñatas, flowers, and crowns for special occasions. There is also Patricia de los Ángeles, who has had a grocery store for 23 years and also makes and sells food. Finally, Lizbeth manages her own grocery store and sells cosmetics. Help to provide them with better profit.

loans.use: to buy highly consumed products such as soda, clothes, sweets and ice cream.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 28 and a married mother of a three-year-old, with whom she is shown in the photograph. For the past three years, she's been doing agriculture to earn an income.

She has about 2 dynym (about half an acre) of agricultural land that her father granted to her, on which she plants beans and corn and seasonal veggies in addition to tending some orchards such as peaches, pears. plums and grape vines.

While she earns a bit of cash from her rural activity, her husband works for wages of $250/month now. He worked in Greece for about 10 years and with the money saved, he managed to build the foundation of a house as seen in the background of the photo.

They need to do more work on it so that they can move in soon before winter kicks in. Up until now, they've been living at some other villagers' house. The amount they're seeking from you is 200,000 ALL (Albanian Lek).

loans.use: to do some more work on the house they're building so that they can move in soon.

loans.name: Audry Lissbette

texts.es: Audry, de 24 años, casada y con un hijo de 3 ½ añitos, esta por primera vez solicitando crédito a ADIM y a los miembros de KIVA, para incrementar su inventario, cubriendo así la demanda que le realizan su su clientela. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, calzado y joyas de acero en su domicilio y de manera ambulante, ahora invertirá en la compra de zapatos deportivos para adultos y niños, y otra parte en prendas de acero como anillos y pulseras. Esta segura que así sus ganancias le darán una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Audry is 24 years old, married with a 3 and a half year old child. This is the first time she is asking for a loan from ADIM and the Kiva members, to increase her inventory, and thus covering the demand of her clients. 

For two years she has earned a living selling used clothes, footwear and jewellery from her home as a mobile seller. Now she will invest in buying sports shoes for adults and children, and some of it in jewellery such as rings and bracelets. 

She is sure that the earnings will give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes for adults and children and some of it to buy jewellery such as rings and  bracelets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de cocos y sandias desde hace 3 años su negocio esta ubicado en la carretera cerca de su casa, y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cocos y sandias por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young woman, with a pixelated face because she is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has made a living selling coconuts and watermelons for 3 years. Her business is located on the road near her home. With the earnings from her sales, she manages to take care of some of her household expenses. This young woman lives with her family in their own home.

She is requesting a loan to buy coconuts and watermelons at wholesale in order to continue with her sales, and in doing so have more income.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and watermelons at wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 39 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo de dos años y 3 sobrinos de 17, 21 y 15 años de edad. Desde hace 7 años Ana instalo una tienda de productos varios, con la cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, además elabora pupusas los fines de semana, mostrando su tenacidad en las ventas. Ana desea invertir en su negocio, ya que hace poco tiempo inicio con la venta de pupusas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, queso, frijoles, maíz, harina de arroz, tomates, etc., para mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Con el crédito anterior ella logro mejorar su tienda e iniciar con su venta de pupusas.
texts.en:
Ana is a 39 years old woman that lives in her own house together with her child of 3 years, and 3 nephews of 17, 21 and 15 years of age. 

7 years ago Ana set up a shop selling various products, which has allowed her to improve things for her family. She also makes pupusas at the weekends, showing her tenacity in sales. 

Ana wishes to invest in her business, given that she only started selling pupusas a short while ago. This is why she is asking for a FUSAI loan to invest in:  pork cracklings, cheese, beans, maize, rice flour, tomatoes etc. to improve her economic income.

With the previous loan she managed to improve her shop and start selling pupusas.

loans.use: to invest in pork cracklings, cheese, beans, maize, rice flour, tomatoes etc. to improve her economic income.

loans.name: Ana Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ana, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, es viuda, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuelas solo dos viven con ella porque los demás ya tienen sus propios hogares, pero en su casa también vive su mamá.

Ana, tiene un molino nixtamal en su casa desde hace 6 años, desde que murió su esposo ella tuvo que buscar ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos.- Además del molino, Ana también se dedica a la agricultura, pero por su edad le cuesta más; es por eso que desea colocar una tienda en la casa, para tener ingresos.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como jabón, detergentes, papel higiénico, arroz, frijoles, etc. el préstamo mejorará su condición de vida y podrá satisfacer algunas necesidades que tienen sus hijos.

Mis sueños son hacer crecer mi negocio comprando nuevos productos para la venta y que la gente necesita.
Para mi familia deseo ayudarlos a cumplir sus objetivos ya que una hija mía ya va a la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old, and she studied in school until the fifth grade. She is a widow, and she has 4 children, of which only two still live with her because the others have their own homes now. However, her mother also lives with her.

Ana has had a corn mill in her home for 6 years. Ever since her husband died, she has had to search for income to support her children. In addition to the mill, Ana also makes a living in agriculture, but it's difficult for her due to her age. For this reason, she would like to start a store in her home to earn income.

Ana needs a loan to buy basic necessities such as soap, detergent, toilet paper, rice, beans, etc. This loan will improve her living conditions, and take care of some of her children's necessities.

Her dream is to grow her business by buying and selling new products that people need. For her family, she would like to help them achieve their goals, since one of her daughters is now in college.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities such as soap, detergent, toilet paper, rice, beans etc.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ly works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Asem

texts.en:
Asem is a 19-year-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector and earns a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Asem is a student at university, where he studies accounting. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses.

Asem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Asem will be able to do his homework and reports easily. Asem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is so encouraged that she accessed loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. They have certainly helped sustain her store and thus helped cover her family's daily sustenance. Her being a single parent is her biggest challenge in life but with her positive outlook and love for her children she has managed to be victorious.

To help her expand her store, she is now seeking to avail of a 20000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income which sustained her family's basic needs and send her children to school. She is hopeful for your positive response.

Marivic aims to see her children finish college to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 47 years old and widowed with eight children. With two children in school, Trinidad works very hard to provide for them.

Trinidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Trinidad has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Trinidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Dulce es una mujer de cuarenta y cinco años de edad, muy responsable y fuerte, al lado de su esposo y teniendo la profesión de costurera ha logrado sacar adelante a cinco hijos. Ella vive un una comunidad semirural, poco a poco ha logrado instalar un servicio higiénico y dejar de usar letrina. 
Dulce ha recurrido a un préstamo, esta vez para ocuparlo en la finalización de construcción de su cuarto de baño, y comprar lava manos, azulejos, ducha, entre otras medidas que le garantizan la buena salud higiénica para su familia. En un futuro desea solicitar otro préstamo que le permita invertir en un negocio y mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Dulce is a 45 year old woman who is very responsible and strong. Her professional is a seamstress and along with her husband has manged to get her five children ahead. She lives in a semi-rural community and little by little has been installing toilet facilities and not using the latrine.

Dulce has turned to a loan this time to take care of finishing the construction of her bathroom and buying a washbasin, tiles, a shower amongst other steps that will guarantee good health and hygiene for her family. In the future she wants to request another loan which will allow her to invest in her business and improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy a washbasin, tiles and a shower amongst others.

loans.name: Puspanjali

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Puspanjali from Bolangir in rural Odisha, India, has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Puspanjali, her husband and her three children are among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis.

Without access to a toilet, her family walks long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

With a toilet in her home, she will be able to lead a healthier life and save the time they spent on walking long distances to relieve themselves.

She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet in her home. Your loan will help her get access to basic sanitation and improved health and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Touch makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ngim's Group

texts.en: Ngim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ngim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Shehzadi

texts.en:
Shehzadi is a fifty-years-old married woman living along with her spouse and children in the backward area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her family members are running a single business, which is sewing bags, each family member assigned a specific task according to their experiences. She sews bags along with her daughter, one of her sons fixes buckles and her husband sells them from his store. In this way her family generating money through mutual efforts.

Nowadays the household expenses and children's basic requirements have increased and need to be fulfill by generating more income. She wants to increase the stock of raw material on a daily basis so her family members can sew more bags and can earn maximum profit against their efforts. Due to lack of availability of funds, Shehzadi requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy rexene, buckles and zippers for sewing lady shoulder bags and then her husband can sell them out from his bags store.

She is very happy after receiving this loan and will be very thankful to the lenders for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy rexene, buckles and zippers for sewing lady's shoulder bags and sell them from her husband's bags store.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raul de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su padre y una tia, el se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de medicina popular, comercializa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados y ya tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Raul is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his father and an aunt. For 7 years he has been working selling popular medicine which he sells itinerantly in the various markets. He has a large clientele due to the quality of his products and his good prices. With what he obtains from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy more popular medicine wholesale and doing this have a higher quality of living along with his family.

loans.use: to buy more popular medicine wholesale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 48 years old. He owns a retail shop. He is a married father of six children, and together with his wife, he runs this business. For the past 10 years, his business has been well.

This is his second time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying the first loan. He will use the money to expand the shop and purchase more washing detergents, cooking fat, sugar, milk, bread, wheat and maize flour.

The anticipated profits will be used to educate his children. He hopes to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase washing detergents, cooking fat, sugar, milk, bread, wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 43 years old and married with four children.

Marlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Marlyn is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 50 years old married and she work hard to help her husband.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maura requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

Maura has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Maura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Yashobanti

texts.en:
Yashobanti is a 23-year-old, charismatic lady from Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She lives with her family in a small house without a hygienic latrine.

Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing. Due to lack of funds, she was unable to build a toilet and had to depend on open space and fields to attend nature's call.

She has asked for a loan from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum for 15,000 INR. This loan will be used to buy and build a toilet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is still not enough to build a toilet and water source by cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a toilet

loans.name: Savun's Group

texts.en: Savun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Savun works as a farmer and also fishes to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Orb's Group

texts.en: Orb’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Orb makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Reab's Group

texts.en: Reab’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Reab makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farmer and village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both Reab and group member Nhor to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Lim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A  senhora Ana de 34 anos de idade   é trabalhadora, casada, mãe  solteira de 3 filhos dos quais 1 na casa de seus avôs, 1 a frequentar o ensino primário e o ultimo ainda menor, é comerciante e vive na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar açúcar, óleo, bebidas, refrescos, velas, doces, sabonetes, dragão para reforçar o seu negocio.
O seu sonho é ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades de seus clientes e construir uma casa para oferecer melhor lar a sua família.
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
34-year-old Ana is a working woman. She is married and the mother of three children; one of them lives with his/her grandparents, one goes to primary school, and the youngest one is still very young. She is a businesswoman and owns the house where she lives.

With this loan, she says that she will buy sugar, cooking oil, beverages, candles, sweets, perfumed soaps, and lighters to strengthen her business.

Her dream is to expand her business in order to better fulfill her customers’ needs and build a house to offer her family a better home.

Her challenges are financial in nature. She has continued to work and is planning to apply for more loans to overcome the obstacles and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, beverages, candles, sweets, perfumed soaps, and lighters to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 36-year-old single lady, who has been working in the clothes selling business since 2002. She is a hard working lady who runs her business from her house. Mariam also provides hairdressing services to her customers upon request.

To increase her business merchandise, Mariam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy new released winter collection, especially for school students to get ready.

She hopes to be able to open a clothes shop in the near future.

loans.use: To increase her clothing merchandise, with a new released winter collection especially for school students to get ready. .

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
