Dorcas is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She has been operating a restaurant for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of food products.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 57 years old and married with four children. Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more grocery stock to sell, such as biscuits, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and personal care products.

Aida has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stock to sell, such as biscuits, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and personal care products.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vicenta is 64 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Vicenta has a buying and selling of home care products business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like brooms, mats, etc.

Vicenta has been in this business for one year. In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like brooms, mats, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school. Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more grocery stock to sell, such as biscuits, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and personal care products.

Lucia has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stock to sell, such as biscuits, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and personal care products.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is applying for a loan of $ 1.000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has four children. She is 27 years old.

Merlinda runs a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock for her store such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, eggs, body lotion, slippers, Coca Cola, Sagiko juice drinks, beer, fish and soap. Merlinda makes good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Merlinda lives in a town near a school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Mwanamkasi has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. In addition to the clothes selling business, she also operates a water selling kiosk that earns her more income.

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en: Yom’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yom works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pushpha

texts.en:
Pushpha, 40, is a humble lady from Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and her 15-year-old daughter, who is pursuing her studies in a secondary school.

She is bitterly affected by the rural sanitation crisis and has to travel a long distance in order to relieve herself. Being a lady, she is vulnerable to molestation and other crimes.

She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet in her house so that she can protect her privacy, safety and hygiene. The loan amount will also help her in promoting cleanliness in the community, and she can safeguard the health of her family and prevent them from unnecessary medical expenses.

She will be very grateful after getting the help and support.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Con 55 años de edad Marta se dedica a la venta de maní con azúcar y salado, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo las calles de su municipio, y mercados aledaños, además los fines de semana por la tarde vende pupusas, con lo que logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Marta vive junto a su nieto de 15 años de edad al que cuida con mucho cariño, y es su única compañía. Marta desea invertir una mayor cantidad de producto para preparar las pupusas y el maní, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, maní, azúcar, queso, tomates, entre otros productos para su venta de maní y pupusas.
texts.en:
At 55 years of age Marta works selling peanuts with sugar and salt a business she does itinerantly in the streets of her municipality and in the neighboring markets. Also on the weekends she sells pupusas in the afternoons which allows her to obtain greater economic revenue.

Marta lives together with her 15 year old grandson who she cares for with much love and is her only company. Marta wants to invest in a greater quantity of product to prepare her pupusas and peanuts but she does not have the economic liquidity. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in pork cracklings, peanuts, sugar, cheese and tomatoes amongst other products for her sales of peanuts and pupusas.

loans.use: to invest in pork cracklings, peanuts, sugar, cheese and tomatoes amongst other products for her sales of peanuts and pupusas.

loans.name: Beardson

texts.en:
Beardson is 33 years old. He is married with five children. He has been practicing small-scale farming for four years, earning an income of 17,000 KES.

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya. He will purchase more agricultural products to plant for a better harvest, both for his customers and his family. He hopes he will earn more income, which will help him pay school fees.

Beardson's hopes for the future are to have a good family and a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more agricultural products to plant for a better harvest.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 47 years old and married with four children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Marivic aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

loans.name: Kumudin

texts.en:
Kumudin, 44, lives in a community of Bolangir, Odisha, India. She has four children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland that is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 10 years. On average, she is able to make an income of 200 INR a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old and married with two children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of groceries to sell like biscuits, breads, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks and other personal care products.

She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from direct selling.

Thelma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell like biscuits, breads, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks and other personal care products.

loans.name: Kigamboni Group

texts.en:
Habiba is in her early 50s and is divorced with five children. Four of them are grown-up and one is still at college. She has been selling second hand clothes for five years now. She works from 09am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Habiba's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase on the second hand clothes stock. She dreams of owning a spare parts shop.

Habiba will share this loan with her loan group Kigamboni which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the second hand clothes stock.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Grupo [Mujeres Luchadoras¨ lo conforman 3 personas, dispuestas a asumir una fianza solidaria para salir adelante con su familia. Estando 8 ciclos, con ADIM, ahora solicitan nuevamente crédito para poder aumentar su inventario. Coordinado por Elsa, de 31 años, acompañada y con dos hijos de edades 12 y 7 años, tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado,  invertirá en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y licras para su varierdad de clientela. 
Las demás socias son Maria, 36 años dedicada a la venta de cosméticos y ropa. Y Martha de 31 años quien vende platanitos de manera ambulante en la afueras de un colegio desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras [Persistent Women] group is comprised of three people. They are ready to take a group loan with the intention to get ahead with their families. They have worked with ADIM for eight cycles, and are requesting a new loan to increase their stock levels.

The group is administered by Elsa, who is 31 years old, married, and has two children aged 12 and 7. She sells clothes and shoes. She will use the loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and athletic clothing to sell to her different customers.

The other members are Maria, who is 36 and sells cosmetics and clothes, and Martha, who is 31 and has been working selling fried plantains as a street vendor outside a school for seven years.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and athletic clothing.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a 58-year-old married mother of four children.

Two years ago Rajaa opened a grocery shop to help her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hardworking and sacrificing mother, who is trying desperately to develop her family's living conditions.

Today, Rajaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car for her son to help him with transportation and facilitate his life.

Rajaa hopes to expand her business in the future, to increase her income, and to stay capable of providing her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a car for her son to help him with transportation.

loans.name: Dionicia Lilian

texts.en:
Dionicia Lilian is 58 years old but still has the eagerness to work to lift her family's standard of living. When she was still single, Dionicia Lilian engaged in a hog raising business. After she married and was blessed with two children, she continued the business. Now, through the raising of hogs she is able to send her children to school. Dionicia Lilian wants to see her children become professionals someday. She and her husband are doing their best to provide for the needs of their children in pursuing their education.

Dionicia Lilian wants to borrow a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes to maintain the business and have a continuous source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Belamati

texts.en:
Belamati is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her two sons. Belamati has been selling fish for eight years, and her husband has been a public transportation driver for 15 years. She and her husband pull together to increase their family income.

Belamati has asked for a loan from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum for 15,000 INR. This loan will be used to buy and build a sanitation unit at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and a water source.

Her family's income is still not enough to build a toilet and water source with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a sanitation unit at her home to improve access to water and sanitation.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is a 32-year-old mother of two children. One of the children is in school while the other is too young to go to school. Sophea is a rice farmer and a paid worker in a brick factory to earn income to cover her family’s daily expense. She has done this work for four years, and it earns her about 10 USD per day. Drought and insect pests have destroyed her crop, causing her to earn a lower income than before.

This is the first Kiva loan with VisionFund for Sophea's group of three, and she is planning to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield. She will spend her remaining money to build a private toilet for her family. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her crop's yield over last year's and enable her to keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Nida raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now. She is a married woman with five children. Her youngest child is 17 and still attending school. Her husband is a farmer.

Nida is asking for a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy pig feed. This will keep her hogs healthy, and in few months to come, she could sell them to her clients. It will improve her livelihood and also enable her to settle her finances. Thus, she could set aside some of the profit for emergency use and continue financing the schooling of her child.

Nida is determined that someday she will become productive, and it will improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace 8 años e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus prodcutos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno para iniciar con la siembra y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, owns the house where she lives with her husband and two children. She has been working growing corn for eight years, and started her business with her own capital. She sells her produce close to where she lives, and gets ahead with the profits she makes.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies to improve the land, start sowing, and in that way receive a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies to improve her land.

loans.name: Roberto Leonel

texts.es: Roberto Leonel, de 53 años, por primera vez solicita crédito para invertirlo en su pulpería, donde obtiene ganancias que les ayuda a brindarles mejores condiciones de vida  a su familia. El y su compañera de vida, tienen un hijo de 18 años a su responsabilidad. Desde hace 10 años inicio su negocio con los ahorros de su salario anterior. Ahora con el crédito invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, queso, frijol,gaseosa, papel higienicos, crema, leña y pollo. Con el inventario abastecido crecerá su venta y por ende las ganancias irán en amento así cumplirá con las cuotas y el mejoramiento económico.
texts.en:
Roberto Leonel is 53 years old, and he is requesting a loan for the first time. He will invest this loan in his small grocery store, which generates him earnings that allow him to provide his family with better living conditions. He and his life partner have an 18-year-old son under their care.

He started his business 10 years ago with savings from his previous salary. Now, with this loan, he will buy rice, sugar, oil, cheese, beans, soda, toilet paper, lotion, firewood, and chicken. With a stocked inventory, his sales will increase as well as his earnings. This way, he will be able to make his loan payments while improving financially.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, cheese, beans, soda, toilet paper, lotion, firewood, and chicken.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is a 29-year-old woman. She has two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Anna Marie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anna Marie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy meat, vegetables, and other supplies.

Anna Marie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Anna Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, and other supplies

loans.name: Jerleta

texts.en:
Jerleta is a 55-year old married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jerleta has a "buy and sell" dry goods business in the Philippines. Jerleta requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell.

Jerleta has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Damaris Susana

texts.es: Damaris, es una mujer responsable, servicial y muy trabajadora, a sus 36 años, soltera. Tiene una pulpería en su hogar desde hace 14 años, gracias a una herencia de su abuela. Con ayuda de sus padres ella comercializa productos para uso domésticos o comestibles, ahora con el crédito lo requiere para invertirlo en arroz, café, papel higiénico, aceite, azúcar y pollo. Con el crédito que recibió anteriormente le ayuda a engrandecer su negocio y su inventario.
texts.en:
Damaris is a responsible, attentive, and hardworking woman. She is 36 and single. She has had a general store at home for fourteen years, inherited from her grandmother. With the help of her parents, she sells her home and food products.

She needs this loan to buy rice, coffee, toilet paper, cooking oil, sugar, and chicken. With the previous loan, she could expand her business and increase her stock levels.

loans.use: to buy rice, coffee, toilet paper, cooking oil, sugar, and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fish in huge amounts

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 31-year-old married man, who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, dealing in cocoa farming. He is also a prominent cocoa trader to earn additional income.

The cocoa business is the main economic activity in this area that has seen Ibrahim build a house. He got involved in these businesses to earn income and meet his increasing demands. He is challenged by bad debtors and seasonality changes that affect his business plan of having a big well-stocked cocoa store in his area.

Ibrahim has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa for resale this peak season. Ibrahim is proud of his business which has helped him to provide basic needs for his family of five children and pay for school fees for the three now attending school.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale this peak season.

loans.name: Carlos Xavier

texts.es:
Carlos es un emprendedor de 35 años, que es caracterizado por su timidez, pero es aún más reconocido por el excelente trabajo que hace en su taller de soldadura y vulcanización desde hace doce años. Él inició con unos ahorros que iba haciendo mientras trabajaba, además el apoyo de su esposa y la motivación de su hijo de seis años de edad, le ha ayudado a salir adelante. 
Ahora que el negocio de Carlos va creciendo con pasos seguros, solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales de soldadura y para la vulcanización, como metales, varillas, hierro, alambres, llantas, tornillos, tenaza, entre otros materiales necesario para ofrecer un servicio de calidad.  Debido a que su taller es en su casa, él sueña que en un futuro pueda extenderse en otro lugar y hacerlo más visible en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 35-year-old entrepreneur. He is characterized by his shyness but is best known for the excellent work that he performs in his welding and vulcanization workshop. He started this business 12 years ago with some savings that he had accumulated while working. In addition, the support of his wife and the motivation of his 6-year-old son have helped him move forward.

Now that Carlos's business is growing steadily, he is requesting a loan to buy welding and vulcanization materials such as metal, rods, iron, wires, tires, screws, and pliers, among other necessary items, in order to offer quality services. Since his workshop is currently located inside his home, he dreams of establishing his business in another location in the future so that it can be more visible in the community.

loans.use: to buy metal, rods, iron, wires, tires, screws, and pliers, among other materials.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, home product care, personal product care, and other groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as can goods, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, home product care, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa who lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda is a hardworking woman dealing in cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the businesses to earn income and meet increasing family demands. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business. Despite the challenges,Kasifa has a determination of keeping her business running as she has always done to ensure that her family gets basic needs. She has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa seeds for drying and resale. She hopes to expand her cocoa business and be able to raise school fees for her three children attending school in Bundibugyo.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa seeds for drying and resale

loans.name: Chemchem Group

texts.en:
Zaituni is in her early forties and is single with five children. Two of them are still in school, and three of them are grown up. She has been running two projects, selling fabrics and food vending for ten years now. She works from 8:00 p.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zaituni's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in mamalishe store. She dreams of opening a beauty salon.

Zaituni will share this loan with her loan group Chemchem, which consists of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Gennelyn

texts.en:
Gennelyn is 28 years old and has four children. Gennelyn is married and has four children who are in school.

Gennelyn is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Gennelyn requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gennelyn has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gennelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 30 years old, and her three children are still in school.

Daisy has a buy-and-sell saints statues business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy different kinds of statues of saints to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of statues of saints to sell.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Cecil works hard to support her family.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cecil is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business.

Cecil has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en:
Geogina is married with four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a restaurant where she deals in cooking and selling food and gets additional income from selling sodas to her customers. She started the business 10 years ago, so far the profits are good.

She is hard working and plans to expand the business, but faces competition and dishonest customers with high default rates, this affects her profits. Geogina has requested for a loan to add capital in her business by buying food staffs and sodas for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to add capital in her restaurant..

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a mother of 4 children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in buying and selling petrol to motorcycle riders on retail basis as she gets additional income from motor cycle transport locally known as bodaboda. She started the business to raise school fees for her children and also to serve her community because people had to move for long distances to reach a petrol station. She works hard and has plans of paying school fees for her children and expanding the business, but lacks enough capital.

Angela is requesting for a loan to buy petrol for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy petrol to sell to motor cycle riders.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Marina es una mujer, que ha demostrado ser trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora, a sus 40 años de edad, ella y su compañero de vida han buscado diversas formas para sacar adelante a sus cuatros hijos. Con el financiamiento de otras financieras ha logrado establecer su venta de frutas. Actualmente requiere del préstamo para la compra de nancite, mamón, piña, plátanos y sandias, de manera que pueda comprarlo por mayor y sacarle ganancias cuando lo comercialice al detalle. Esperando tener mayores ingresos que le permitan sostener su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Marina is woman who has proven that she is very hardworking, responsible, and enterprising. She is 40 years old and with her life partner they have sought various ways to succeed raising their four children.

With financing through other sources, she has managed to establish her fruit selling business. Currently, she requires this loan to purchase nancite (local fruit), pineapple, bananas, and watermelon. In this way she can purchase wholesale and obtain profits when she sells retail. She is hoping to have better income that will allow her to sustain her family's finances.

loans.use: to purchase nancite (a local fruit), papaya, pineapple, bananas, and watermelons.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a loving mother, grandmother, and wife. She is 57 years old, married, and has five children. She is taking care of her grandchildren because their mother is working abroad.

Concepcion runs a retail business. Aside from her retail business, she is also engaged in a livestock business.

At present, Concepcion is focusing on managing her retail business, which is selling various grocery items. Concepcion wanted to extend the goods she is selling in order to raise her income, too. This reason drove her to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, powdered milk, coffee, and many more items.

Concepcion expects a positive outcome through the loan she will borrow.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, powdered milk, coffee, and many more items.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman and owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Bahati has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, a 51-year-old mother of a child, is living in a rural area of Kandal province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she has grown rice and sold snacks for 11 years.

Her family’s living has improved since she took her first Kiva loan via VisionFund and managed it properly.

Recently, her health has not been so well, and she had to spend some of her income to cure her illness, which causes her to have not enough funds to fulfill her dream.

This loan is the second loan cycle for her, and she is wanting to buy more farmland to expand her farming area, as her wish. She is really hopeful for this loan that she will successfully expanded her current business — the rice farming business — and be able to earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to expand her farming area to earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Nona Faith

texts.en:
Nona Faith works hard to support her family. Nona Faith is single with one child. She has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines.

Nona Faith requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nona Faith has been in this business for one year now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

In the future, Nona Faith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old now.

Gemma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as spices, fish, meat, etc.

Gemma has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as spices, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Sapnah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sapnah. Sapnah is 33 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her child. She has one daughter. Sapnah and her husband have a business producing shoes; they have worked for ten years. They pull together to increase their family's income.

Sapnah has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for IDR 4,500,000. This loan will be used to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and water source for the family. Her family's income is still not enough to build a toilet and water source with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 46 years old, and six of her children are in school.

Erlinda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 35 years old and single with one child. Melanie works very hard to provide for the family.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of groceries to sell like biscuits, breads, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks and other personal care products.

Melanie has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell like biscuits, breads, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks and other personal care products.

loans.name: Hada Rubidia

texts.es: Hada de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados desde hace 19 años, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Fifty-two year old Hada lives in her own house with her domestic partner. She has worked selling clothing as a street vender in different markets for nineteen years. She has many regular customers because of the quality of her clothing and the good prices.

What she earns covers some of her household expenses. She is asking for another loan to buy more wholesale clothing to be able to continue her sales and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Anita is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her family group. For some 10 years now she has made and sold tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to get ahead.

Anita is requesting a loan to purchase corn by the hundred-weight and also mineral lime, so she can continue making tortillas and, thus, be able to increase her income, in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn by the hundred-weight and, also, mineral lime for her tortilla-making business.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge habitant à Tokoin. Akossiwa est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Akossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des tas de friperies  afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a married woman with four children in her care, living in Tokoin. She resells used clothing and stocks up three times a month at the market, reselling her inventory in surrounding neighborhoods.

To have a large selection and maximize her profit, Akossiwa is requesting this loan to order some piles of used clothing so that she can respond to the many needs of her clients, earn a profit, and help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two piles of used clothing.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermano, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 30 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, con las ventas que realiza de sus productos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. Y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Manuel, 45 years old, lives in his own house with his mother and his brother. He has worked growing corn for more than 30 years. With the sales he carries out of his products, he achieves covering some of the expenses of his home. He is applying again for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to therefore be able to obtain better economic income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn in bulk to be able to improve her income and continue supporting her son with his studies.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 47 years old and has four children who are presently in school.

Evangeline has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Evangeline has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Abigael

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Abigael est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans vivant à Tokoin. Abigael est une revendeuse des caleçons pour petits et grands qu’elle s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant et à domicile. Abigael sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de caleçons pour petits et grands afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Abigael is a married woman aged 32, living in Tokoin. She resells underwear for adults and children. She stocks up six times a month at the market and resells the goods in surrounding neighborhoods and out of her house.

Abigael is asking for this loan to order several dozen pairs of underwear for children and adults so as to make a profit and help cover the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy eight dozen pairs of children's underpants and seven dozen pairs of underwear for adults.

loans.name: Mern's Group

texts.en: Mern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Mern makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es: Marta es una mujer de 30 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina y elote, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios además de darles lo mejor que puede. Marta logro construir su vivienda hace varios años en la que vive junto a sus 3 hijos una niña de 4 años y dos varones de 11 y 7 años de edad. Marta desea invertir en su negocio de venta de tamales de gallina y elote, para mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, gallinas, elotes, azúcar, sal, etc., para su venta de tamales.
texts.en:
Marta, 30, earns a living selling chicken and corn tamales.  She is able to support the household economy this way and happy to provide her children with the best education she can.  

Marta was able to build a house several years ago where she lives with her three children, a daughter, 4, and two sons, ages 11 and 7.  In order to invest in her chicken and corn tamales business to improve her income, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy corn, chicken, corn on the cob, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.use: To buy maize, chicken, corn on the cob, sugar, salt, etc. for her tamales sales.

loans.name: Machinjioni Group

texts.en:
Chemela who is in his early 50s is a married with five children, four of them are grown up and one is still in school. He has been selling second hand clothes for three years now and works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Chamela’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on increasing the second hand clothes stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the fast class second hand stock and meet his customers' request. He dreams of opening another second hand clothes shop.

Chemela will share this loan with his loan group MACHINJIONI which consists of six members who will hold each other accountant able for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast class second hand stock and meet his customers' request.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells motorcycle spares, which he has been involved in for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of products.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spares. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land and a motor vehicle. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motorcycle spares.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is so encouraged that she accessed loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. Those loans certainly helped sustain her store and thus provided for her family's daily needs. There are struggles to overcome living in a country with a developing economy but Salvacion's family lives happily for as long as their family is intact.

She trusts that she can again avail of a Php 25000 loan to refill her store with grocery items such as rice, canned goods, beverages, instant noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been a good source of income. There are days that her sales is low but she is thankful that God always sees them through. She will be grateful again or your positive response on her request.

Salvacion simple dream is for her store to grow and prays for good health for her and her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 53 years old and married with nine children. One child is still in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, soap and other personal care products to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, soap and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en: Korn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Korn works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Si's Group

texts.en:
A vendor who lives in Battambang province, Si is in her 45 years of age and married. She is blessed with three dependent children, two of whom are in school and the remaining one is too young for schooling. The main income of this family comes from selling grocery items which Si has been involved in for ten years. She spends her spare time on working for others for a fee to supplement income too. The main obstacle to vending business is lacking of working of working capital.

This is the first time for her requesting for a loan from VisionFund and Si, the leader of two-member group, will use her entire loan to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to be able to keep sending her children to school so that they can have bright future and be good citizens.

loans.use: to buy more kind of grocery items to attract more customers so that she can earn more income for keep supporting her children's studying. .

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea and has been involved in this business for 6 years.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mujeres de Negocio”, conformado por 3 mujeres quienes trabajan fuertemente para poder alcanzar sus sueños y metas. Están con ADIM, por 6 ciclos para seguir mejorando e invirtiendo en sus negocios.  Coordinado por Guadalupe, quien desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de joyas y cosméticos gracias a los préstamos realizados en ADIM. Con el dinero que solicita ella comprara joyas como anillos, pulseras y collares, además de cosméticos como cremas, lápiz labiales, pantalones. Estos son los más demandados por su clientela. 
Las demás socias son Francis, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante en su comunidad, y Marina dedicada a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres de Negocios" (Business Women) is comprised of three women who work hard to meet their goals and realize their dreams.  They have been involved with ADIM for six loan cycles, trying to continue to improve their businesses through investment.

The group is coordinated by Guadalupe who has been selling jewelry and cosmetics for seven years thanks to loans received from ADIM.  She uses the funds to buy jewelry such as rings, bracelets and necklaces, and also buys cosmetics, including creams and lipsticks, as well as pants.  These are the items in highest demand by her customers.

The other members are Francis, who works as a street vendor selling used clothing in her community, and Marina, who sells clothing as a street vendor and has been in business for three years.

loans.use: To buy jewelry: rings, bracelets and necklaces; cosmetics such as creams and lipsticks; and pants

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail business where he sells watches, wallets, belts and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of watches, wallets, belts and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will open a shop. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of watches, wallets, belts and other items

loans.name: Kathia Isabel

texts.es: Kathia de 33 años es una microempresaria que continuó con el legado de su madre quien durante toda su vida se dedicó al comercio de mercancías varias logrando captar recursos para el beneficio de su familia. En el año 2010 ella decidió seguirle los pasos a su madre y emprendió su propio negocio de venta de productos de uso personal con los cuales ofrece a sus dos hijos menores de edad una mejor calidad de vida y aporta a los gastos de su hogar en conjunto con su cónyuge.  Esta emprendedora mujer comercializa prendas de vestir, calzado, bolsos, perfumes, cremas corporales, splash y demás artículos que sus clientes le encarguen, el éxito de su negocio se debe a su compromiso que se evidencia en su día a día; dedica doce horas a esta actividad sin descuidar las labores y compromisos familiares. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en productos como perfumes, cremas, splash, productos capilares, prendas de vestir y calzado. Con esta inversión podrá incrementar sus ventas y su surtido de artículos.  Su meta  a futuro es abrir un local y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Kathia, 33, is a microentrepreneur who continued with the legacy of her mother who, during all of her life, dedicated herself to the business of various merchandise, achieving capturing resources for the benefit of her family. In the year 2010, she decided to follow the footsteps of her mother and started her own business selling personal use products, with which she offers her two young-aged children a better quality of life and supports the expenses of her home along with her spouse. This female entrepreneur sells apparel, shoes, bags, perfumes, body creams, splash and more articles that her customers order from her. The success of her business is due to her commitment that is evidenced in her day by day; she works twelve hours at this activity without neglecting the family work and commitments.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in products like perfumes, creams, splash, hair products, apparel and shoes. With this investment, she will be able to increase her sales and her stock of articles. Her goal in the future is to open a storefront and remodel her home.

loans.use: to invest in products like perfumes, creams, splash, hair products, apparel and shoes.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary is 54 years old and married with two dependent children in school. She lives in Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she is running a tailoring clothes business, which she has involved in for 25 years. She is also selling some snacks in a small stall in front of her house to add more income. The total income of this family is about 11USD per day and Nary is able to save approximately about 6USD each day to support family.

Because she lacks of working capital, she is now leading a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan to keep her tailoring business running by buying more kind of cloth to attract more customers. She hopes that both of her businesses run smoothly and earn good income to her to support children’s education and meet the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of cloth to attract more customers so that she can earn more income to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single mother of one child who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 3 Group

texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old and she is married with three children. She has been selling smoked and fresh fish for 9 years now. Esther lives in Teshie, Accra-Ghana.

Her family is a low-income household in the city, however, the market demand for fish is high because it is everyday consumable commodity. The main hardship that Esther faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish which she will sell some fresh and also smoke the rest and sell to her customers.

Before borrowing money from ID-Ghana micro finance institution, she was selling from the little money she has. In 2011, Esther joined ID-Ghana micro finance institution to improve her business. She used her loans to purchase fish to sell fresh and smoke the rest, so that the income also increases. Esther is the group representative of Ekomefeemo, which consists of 6 members. With her business profit, Esther hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell fresh and smoke the rest, so that the income also increases.

loans.name: Phern's Group

texts.en: Phern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Phern works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single young man who opened three years ago his grocery shop to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and independent man who dreams of a better future and has his own goals to achieve. He is trying hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with new products and items to satisfy his customers' needs with diversified products. 
Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with new products and items

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 44-year-old Palestinian refugee, a married mother of four children. She runs a small grocery store since 1991 to provide her family with a better living.
Amina is very supportive to her family members, she is working hard to provide them with the necessary living needs, and develop her business in a well managed way.
Since her business income can barely cover her family's needs and provide slight increase in capital, Amina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children school tuition fees to make sure that she is not affecting her business capital and family's income at the same time.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business to make sure that she can provide her children with future expected university degrees.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en vivienda familiar junto a sus tres pequeñas hijas de 6 años, 11 años y 8 años de edad a las cuales está sacando adelante en sus estudios porque quiere que sean grandes personas en la vida ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se preocupa por llevar el sustento al hogar y que no les falte nada. Silvia se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 5 años por el cual es así como ella mantiene la economía del hogar. Silvia desea invertir más en su negocio ya que son muchas la personas que degustan de su producto, por lo que  solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frijoles quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, repollo, manteca, consomé, y bebidas ya que desea cumplir con la demanda que solicitan sus cliente y a la vez mejorar su condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 31, is a single mother who lives at home with her three young daughters, ages 6, 8 and 11.  She provides them with an education so that when they grow up they will be fine people.  A very had worker, Silvia makes sure that her household lacks for nothing.

For five years Silvia has been selling pupas (stuffed tortillas) to support the household economy.  She wants to invest more in her business since she has many customers.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy beans, cheese, pork crackling, tomatoes, cabbage, lard, consommé and beverages to meet customer demand.  This will also improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy beans, cheese, pork cracklings, tomatoes, cabbage, lard, consommé and beverages to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one and half years she has operated a clothing business, selling clothes from door to door to her neighbors and passersby.

Asha is requesting a loan of 25,000 KES to purchase new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 39 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods.

Lynette has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lynette aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and snack foods

loans.name: Sokunteary's Group

texts.en: Sokunteary’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokunteary makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
As a  parent of four children, Mariefe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish. Mariefe is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, bamboo, paints, etc for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Mariefe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, bamboo, paints, etc for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 28-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ibraheem took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: To buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 49 years old and is married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ofelia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a 30-year-old married woman who runs a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about growing her business but needs additional working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. 

Amelia will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as candles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, beer, biscuits, water, body lotion and slippers. She is happy that Tuba Rai Metin offers loans to people in need.

loans.use: to buy candles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, beer, biscuits, water, body lotion and slippers to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a 46-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with five children. The oldest child is 19 years old while the youngest child is nine years old. Angelina and her husband earn a living by fishing. It has been their main source of income for three years. They work hard to provide for the needs of their children. Angelina is asking for a loan to buy fishing net to increase their catch. In the future, she wishes to send all her children to college and finish a degree. Perhaps they need to improve their livelihood to have enough money to send their children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is a married woman with nine children. She is 60 years old and has one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Constancia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like garments and thread for her business.

Constancia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Constancia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like garments and thread for her tailoring business

loans.name: Tia

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Tia. Tia is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has two sons. Tia is a housewife and her husband has been an employee in a factory for 10 years. They pull together to increase the family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for IDR 4,500,000. This loan will be used to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and water sources for families. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water sources by cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en: Cresilda is a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. She is a 38-year-old married woman and has a twelve-year-old daughter. Her husband works hard as a seaman and she helps her husband by starting to raise pigs. They work together to give the best to their daughter. Cresilda is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. In the future, she wants to increase her business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
Насиба молодая женщина. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятеро детей.  Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Насиба мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Насиба выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Насиба никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Насиба вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Насиба выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Насиба получает хороший доход. Муж Насибы также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Насиба с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Насиба заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a young woman.  She's 29, married and has 5 children.  She lives in a small rural village.  Starting in childhood, Nasiba dreamed of becoming a teacher, but she ended up never being able to attend university due to her family's finances.  Right after finishing secondary school, Nasiba married and became a housewife.  But even though she spends most of her time in the home, she's never idle.  She and her husband do everything possible to provide their children with all the necessities of life.

To have a constant source of income for food, Nasiba and her husband started their own business raising livestock.  Nasiba raises cattle, then sells the milk and meat they produce.  She earns a good living from this business.  Nasiba's husband also works in a local workshop, and his work brings in extra money for the family.  Their combined income is enough for an average standard of living, and they have enough to money to pay for all their current needs.  

At the moment, Nasiba and her husband want to buy a few more heads of cattle for fattening.  She's thus requested a loan from Arvand to put towards buying cattle.  Nasiba thanks Arvand in advance for their support, which will result in her family's quality of life improving.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 52 years old. He lives in one of the frontier villages of Tavush region and in the village of Aygehovit. He is married and he has two sons. His elder son now is in the army passing his military service and his smallest son is school-aged. With his beloved wife Gevorg is engaged in farming now. For many years he used to work as a policeman at the police station, but it has already been 10 years since he continued his father’s work, which is farming. Gevorg inherited this farm from him and he does his best now as he knows how much his father loved and cared for it.

Now on the farm he has cows, calves, pigs, horses, chickens and beehives. His farm differs from many other farms in the village as he has a great and very nice vineyard. His orchard is unbelievably beautiful and colorful and here there are persimmon, apple, fig and apricot trees. All his farm products he sells at the city’s wholesale market and this is the only source of income for his family. Especially his farm’s pork and beef are in great demand among his customers. Now Gevorg is asking for this loan as he wants to buy fodder for his farm cows and pigs, since the lack of fodder for his cattle is very bad and it will also greatly reduce his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cows and pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman with two children ages 11 and nine years old. She is a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. Her husband works hard as a laborer while she sells food to the community to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and fruits. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and fruits

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчон, мужчина в возрасте 27 лет, женат, имеет 3 детей. Умедчон работает в кафе. Там он выпекает национальную выпечку из теста «самса». Так как у него очень маленькая зарплата, он дополнительно занимается дехканством. Ему также помогает его жена. Она швея и этим немножко зарабатывает. Умедчон кроме семьи еще обеспечивает маму и братика. Несмотря на то что они очень мало получают они живут очень счастлива, ведь счастье не в деньгах. У них очень крепкая и дружная семья.  Умедчон и его жена очень сильно любят своих детишек и ради них готовы на все. Сейчас они хотят, чтобы их дети жили в достатке, не нуждались ни в чем. Поэтому они решили купить для них хорошую мебель, чтоб они жили в комфорте. Но к большому сожаления все деньги накопленные ими на хорошую, качественную мебель не хватит. Вместе посоветовав обратились в Арванд для получения кредита, заранее благодарны за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Umedjon is a man of the age of 27 years. He is married and has three children. Umedjon works in a cafe. There he makes samosa, a traditional pastry. As he has a small income, he is also a dekhan farmer. He also helps his wife. She is a seamstress and earns some money from this.

Umedjon also provides for his mother and brother, in addition to his family. Despite his low income they live very happily. After all, happiness does not come from money. They are a very robust and friendly family.

Umedjon and his wife love their children very much and would do anything for them. They would like their children to live in prosperity and not be in need of anything. Therefore they decided to purchase good furniture for them, so they will be comfortable. Unfortunately the money they have saved are not enough for good and high quality furniture. Together they decided to turn to "Arvand" to get a loan. They thank you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 2 Group

texts.en:
This group, Ekomefeem 2, consists of four women who have foodstuff, groceries, soft drinks and a local food joint and cook rice and stew and always repay their loans successfully.

Joycelyn (standing on the far left) is the representative of this group and she is requesting a new loan because she ended the last one successfully. She is married, 35 years old, and the mother of three children. In order to increase her capital, she is requesting a new loan from ID-Ghana to buy cassava dough, corn dough, cassava powder, charcoal, fish, meat and other ingredients to cook food and sell to customers and also to buy drinks to sell alongside the food. She is a very brave woman. Her earnings will go towards savings and helping her husband take care of the family.

loans.use: to buy cassava dough, corn dough, cassava powder, charcoal, fish, meat and other ingredients to cook food and sell to customers.

loans.name: Matongo

texts.en:
Matongo is 49 years old. He is married with four children.

He has been in the business for the last 13 years, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to add more stock of goats to meet his clients' demands as well as his family's.

He hopes this will help him pay school fees.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a good family and a stable business.

loans.use: to add more stock of goats to meet his clients' demands as well as his family's.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 55-year-old married mother of three. She started a year ago, selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker who is gaining a good reputation in her region.

Alia is trying hard to develop her business; thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.

Alia hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас очень талантливая и ответственная женщина. Ей 42 года. Проживает вместе с мужем и двумя детьми в городе Канибадам. С раннего детства мать Мукаддас привила ей любовь к шитью. И вот на протяжении 15 лет она профессионально занимается этим видом деятельности. У Мукаддас есть давняя мечта открыть собственное ателье и набрать учениц. Однако для этого нужно достаточно крупное вложение. Так посовещавшись с мужем, Мукаддас решила обратиться к Вам за помощью в приобретении кредита. Мукаддас верит, что с Вашей помощью она сможет купить вышивальную машинку, и другие необходимые предметы для открытия ателье.
texts.en:
Mukaddas is a very talented and responsible woman. She is 42 years old. She lives together with her husband and two children in Konibodom. Since her early childhood Mukaddas' mother instilled in her a love of sewing. Now she has worked professionally with this for a period of 15 years.

Mukaddas has long dreamed of opening her own studio and take in apprentices. However she needs to make a rather large investment to do this. After conferring with her husband, Mukaddas decided to turn to you for help and take a loan.

Mukaddas believes that with your help she will be able to purchase an embroidery machine and other necessary things for opening a studio.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and other necessary things to open a studio

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is a 55-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. To earn a living, she sells dried fish while her husband works hard as a fisherman. They work hard together to provide for the needs of their children. Marcela has been in this business of selling dried fish for almost 16 years. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell to increase their livelihood. In the future she wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 23 years old. He is married with five children.

He has been practicing small scale farming for four years, earning an income of KES 17,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more agricultural products to plant for a higher harvest for customers and family satisfaction as well.

He hopes this will help him pay school fees.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a good family and a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more agricultural products to plant for a higher harvest for customers and family satisfaction as well.

loans.name: Eveketi

texts.en:
Eveketi, who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, is a hardworking woman who buys and sells cocoa. She got involved in the business to earn income to meet increasing family demands. She also has cocoa gardens which generate additional income. 

She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business. Eveketi has asked for a loan to buy cocoa to sell. She previously used a loan to expand her cocoa business and used the profits from the expansion to buy good chairs for her sitting room.  

Eveketi thanks Kiva for changing her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 56 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child in school.

Sofia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Sofia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
