Anahit is 58 years old and she lives with her husband in Geghamavan village of the Gegharkunik region. Anahit’s daughter is married and she lives with her family. Her son is now in the Russian Federation where he does various construction work and sends money for his parent’s needs.

In the village, Anahit is engaged in farming and takes care of her farm cattle. She has cows, calves, a heifer and pigs. With her husband they sell a lot of meat and milk from their farm and in this way make a decent income for their small family.

Now Anahit’s farm cattle are lacking fodder. She hopes that as a solution to this problem, Kiva lenders will be so kind as to support her with a loan of 500.000 AMD which she will use to purchase cattle fodder.

loans.use: to purchase cattle fodder.

loans.name: Martha Mariela

texts.es:
Martha es una joven que desde pequeña es muy dedicada y humanitaria. Siempre se vio atraía por las medicinas y su impacto en la salud de las personas. Por esta razón, ella decidió estudiar Farmacia, carrera donde desde ya se siente realizada, puesto que ya está en su último año de la licenciatura y que desde hace cuatro años le ha abierto las puertas a laborar como Auxiliar en una farmacia. 
A sus 29 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña de tres años de edad que la inspira a seguir adelante, junto con su esposo quien la apoya todo el tiempo. Por esta razón, ella se siente segura de solicitar un préstamo para cerrar con este ciclo de su licenciatura y poder pagar su curso de titulación. De manera que podrá obtener su título y optar por un mejor trabajo. En sus planes está sacar más adelante un posgrado.
texts.en:
Martha is a youth who since she was young has been very dedicated and humanitarian. She has always been attracted by medicine and it's impact on people's health. For this reason she decided to study Pharmacy, a course she now feels has fulfilled as she is in her last year of the degree. Four years ago she opened the door to the work world as an assistant Pharmacist in a pharmacy.

At the age of 29 she is the mother of a three year old daughter who inspires her to continue onward together with her husband who always supports her. For this reason she feels secure in requesting a loan to complete this cycle of her degree and be able to pay for her final courses. In this way she can obtain her receive her degree and choose better employment. In her plans for the future is post graduate studies.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation courses.

loans.name: Eugenio Ermenegildo

texts.es:
Tras pasar varios años trabajando como auxiliar de distintos servicios, entre ellos chofer de taxi, y no necesariamente en el área de contabilidad de una institución, lo han hecho más luchador por querer regresar a su sueño principal, el cual es ser licenciado en Contabilidad pública y de finanzas. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y de sus hijos, quienes todo el tiempo bsucan ser parte del crecimiento mutuo. 
Este emprendedor de 49 años de edad, siente que no hay hora para dejar de aprender, por lo que Eugenio decidió concluir con esta última parte, después de varios años. Razón por la que solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y así poder ampliar sus oportunidades, laborales obteniendo al final ese título como contar público y de finanzas. En sus planes está cambiar de empleo y buscar uno acorde a lo estudiado.
texts.en:
Eugenio has spent various years working as an assistant in different areas, including as a taxi driver, and not necessarily in the accounting section of an institution. This has increased his drive to return to his primary dream, which is to be licensed in public accounting and finances. Fortunately he has the support of his wife and children, who constantly seek to grow together.

This 49 year old entrepreneur feels that one should never stop learning, which is why he decided to finish this last step, after many years. For that reason he seeks a loan to pay for the costs associated with obtaining his degree, thereby broadening his employment opportunities by finally obtaining a degree in public accounting and finance. He plans to change jobs and look for one based on what he's studied.

loans.use: to pay costs associated with his degree.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is from Novaya Kahovka. She works at a local market selling women's sportswear. Svetlana launched her business 19 years ago.
 
Svetlana is planning to use 37,000 UAH to purchase t-shirts, sweatshirts, jackets, and sweatsuits to sell to her male customers this fall. By the beginning of every new season, market vendors in Ukraine like Svetlana have to re-stock their merchandise investing in inventory that is in demand among their clientele.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, sweatshirts, jackets, and sweatsuits to sell to her male customers this fall

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
HUMAIRA is 36-years, and lives with three daughters and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. The financial condition of her home is not good. She does not have personal money to help her family, which is why HUMAIRA contacted with the BRAC for a Kiva loan. 

Her brother owns a general store in a nearby town for many years. He sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits to his customers. He provides for his household necessities from his own store, and his relatives like to purchase from his general store. 

Nowadays, the demand for products have increased, but her brother does not have enough cash to buy inventory to cope with the demand. Therefore, HUMAIRA requested a loan for her brother so that he can buy wheat, rice, flour, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. HUMAIRA hopes that her brother will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. 

HUMAIRA thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, flour, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits and other items for her brother's general store.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a hardworking 40-year-old divorced mother of three children, who is taking the full responsibility of taking care and educating her children since her divorce.

In 2015, Hanan started working in a toy store to provide her children with the necessary living needs. Unfortunately, her limited monthly salary isn't enough to cover her increasing necessary living needs, and she has acquired a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. Through this loan, Hanan will pay for her children's school tuition fees, and buy the necessary requested school supplies.

She hopes to continue to provide for her children's living needs.

loans.use: to buy the necessary requested school supplies, and pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Zovaber village of the Gegharkunik region with her husband, daughter (a student), son and retired mother-in-law.

Gayane has never been employed but thanks to her many years of work on the farm she is already a master in this field. On her farm she has cows, calves, lambs, sheep and chickens. She also has a very good and tasty harvest of potatoes from her land. Gayane sells her farm’s milk, meat and eggs to her neighbors. This woman relies greatly on Kiva support which she will use for the purchase of animal fodder for her farm cattle.

She is thankful and will be happy to be able to provide enough fodder to her cattle thanks to this loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has two grown children – a 25-year-old son and a 33-year-old daughter.  She is a entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. She rents a facility downtown in her home city where she sells linens, sheets, blankets, pillows, etc. Yelena also owns a vending kiosk at a big market in town. She has been in business for 6 years. 

Recently Yelena underwent knee surgery and is recovering now. Yelena is seeking 40,000 UAH to purchase and assortment of merchandise such as a variety of bed sets and some quality blankets of different thickness and synthetic fiber fill material to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of merchandise such as a variety of bed sets and some quality blankets of different thickness and synthetic fiber fill material

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 49-year-old mother of 17-year-old child.  She is from Tubigon, Bohol.       

Rosario is engaged in networking products to earn a living. Aside from this, she also sells food. She has been doing this for 20 years. Thus, Rosario is requesting a loan to buy products to sell like coffee, chocolate drinks, food supplements, vitamins, and beauty products. 

In the future, she wishes to increase her business from retail to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy coffee, chocolate drinks, food supplements, vitamins, and beauty products

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is a small entrepreneur from Khoost. He is married and has an 11-year-old son Vladik. Vitaliy sells electric devices from his warehouse/store that is located in his house. Vitaliy remodeled a part of his house to turn it into a storage place and a little shop where his customers come to shop for electric appliances. 

Vitaliy is hoping to invest 60 000 UAH to purchase a vehicle for his business. Vitaliy is planning to hire one more sales representative and needs a car that his new employee could drive. Vitaliy is also thinking about adding a second business venture to the existing one; in the near future he wants to start manufacturing swimming pools for sale. 

Vitaliy and his wife are thinking about having a second child, too, hoping that business will provide their bigger family with consistent and sufficient income.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for his business

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en:
Yasmine has been working in Mouneh (food preservation) business which she runs from her house since 1998. Yasmine is 29 years old and a married mother of four children. She works hard to assist her husband in covering their family's living needs.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to make sure that she can provide her children with the best education. Her loan will be used to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

Her business is developing properly due to her extensive experience which she learned from her parents.  Working in this domain provided her with special talents.

Yasmine hopes to keep on expanding her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa will be thankful if for the third time Kiva lenders will help her to have more profits from her farming and also greatly change her family’s income from this occupation. 

Larisa lives in Tsaghkunk village of Gegharkunik region. She lives with her son and husband; both of them are employed. Larisa used to work at the school as a Russian Language teacher for a long time, but the needs and financial hardships of the family made her leave that activity and develop farming. In her farm Larisa has cows, calves, and chickens. With the help of her husband Larisa sells a lot of beef, milk, and eggs from her farm. She mentions that particularly meat selling brings income for her family that solves their financial needs. 

Larisa hopes that her third Kiva loan will surely be the delight of both Kiva lenders and of her family as well. This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams will be used for the purchase of one more calf for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a calf for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Anjelika

texts.en:
Anjelika is from Melitopol. She is 39, married, and has two daughters. Anjelika is a market vendor and sells women's clothing at one of the biggest marketplaces of her home town. Anjelika has been running a vending location for 15 years. 

Anjelika is seeking 65,000 UAH to buy additional knitted wear, lingerie, pajamas, and other clothing items to diversify her merchandise assortment. 

Anjelika is hoping to continue to see her business grow with this additional funding and her experience running a small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy additional knitted wear, lingerie, pajamas, and other clothing items to diversify her merchandise assortment

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria tiene 47 años de edad,madre soltera, vive con su hijo y su nieto en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Flor de Maria se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Flor de Maria espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is 47 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her son and grandson in a rural zone of the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Perú. The inhabitants of this district work primarily in agriculture, cattle raising and business.

Flor de Maria makes a living raising and selling small animals such as chicks, hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. Her business is located at her house. She has 3 years experience in the business with very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan she seeks will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys and chicks, among others, as well as for balanced food for them. With the loan Flor de Maria hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate increased income and thereby better her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, can goods, noodles, chips, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marivic dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, can goods, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: With God Group

texts.en:
The "With God" group is made up of four members. They are from Teshie, Accra-Ghana. They are characterized as hard-working and responsible with the desire to improve themselves. They sell salt, pepper, cooking utensils, table clothes, second hand clothing, and provide hairdressing services. Sadly, due to the lack of resources, they couldn't go to school and saw the need to work to help with the household expenses. Currently, they struggle to get their children ahead and offer them the opportunities that they didn't have.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the representative named Gifty works selling second clothing. She works twelve hours each day selling her products. She does business by going from house-to-house to sell to her customers. She has regular and occasional customers and the goal of the loan is to restock her inventory by purchasing a bale of second hand clothing so that she may increase her income. 

The "With God" group is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer them in order to have dignified means of work.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of second hand clothing

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is a young and already prosperous beekeeper in Gavar city, in Gegharkunik region. He has over 80 bee families in his farm. He also has the entirety of the professional tools and equipment, and the special uniforms for working with his bees. Manvel mentions that he is happy with his occupation and likes his work, very much. He describes the care of each animal that gives some product to man or even not, he believes that man must show his thankfulness to that animal, with attention and love, through his care for the animal. It is the same with bees, which are rather aggressive by their nature, and man must be very careful and attentive, as sometimes bees may cause him rather serious harm. But, thanks to his patience and great love towards his work, Manvel has never had any difficulties while working with the bees. The honey that he squeezes is very tasty, pure and healing. A number of people come, even from far distances, to buy his farm’s honey.

Manvel has a nice family. He lives with his wife (she is a teacher) and two school-aged children. This loan of 600.000 Armenian drams Manvel asks, because he wants to make his bee families more numerous, and he prepares to buy several new bee families for his farm.

loans.use: to buy several new bee families for his farm.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single mother of two children. She is her children's only breadwinner. She deals in a bar and coffee business. This season being the peak season, she is concentrating much on coffee. She buys it from distant places and brings it to her store, where her customers come to buy from her.

Joyce is doing very well in her business, because she has both quality and quantity, which makes her different from others. Of late, Joyce's clients have overwhelmingly increased, to such a degree that at the moment she does not have any stock, having sold it off. She is requesting a loan for money to buy coffee for selling, and satisfying her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for selling.

loans.name: Zohour Al Basateen Group

texts.en:
Joumana is the featured borrower for Zohour Al Basateen Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard, to develop their businesses and living at the same time.
Joumana is a 46-year-old, single lady, who works in selling home appliances to cover her needs and expenses. She is an independent and ambitious lady, who is working hard to improve her living conditions despite her limited salary.

Today, Joumana is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to start a new business of selling cosmetics, as a second source of income. Joumana is the first lady on the right. With respect to the other group members, Aida is the lady standing in the middle, and Souamaya is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling cosmetics, as a second source of income.

loans.name: Ma. Hermes

texts.en:
Ma. Hermes earns a living by hog raising business. She has raises and sold hogs for six years now. She is a married woman with three dependents ages 11, 10 and 5 years old respectively.
Aside from hog raising , she also sells dried fish and barbecue during night time.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, supplies like dried fish and utensils use in barbecue vending.These materials are vital in augmenting her sources of income. She could continue sold barbecue to the local in her place. She could also raises quality hogs to be able to support her family needs. With these, her finances will be stable.

Ma Hermes is doing her very best to improve her business to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed , supplies like dried fish and utensils used in barbecue vending.

loans.name: Anaximandro

texts.es:
Anaximandro tiene 64 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en casa propia de material rústico en el caserío San Gerardo de Churcas, del distrito de Colasay que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Anaximandro se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Anaximandro espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anaximandro is 64 years old. He lives with his common law wife in a house he owns made of rustic material in the village of San Gerardo de Churcas, in the district of Colasay, in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this district is peaceful. The inhabitants work primarily in agriculture, business and cattle raising.

Anaximandro works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 8 years experience in the field, with very good business and personal references in the area.

The loan he will receive will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to achieve adequate maintenance of his coffee crop, as well as to hire labor for the harvest season. In this way, Maximandro hopes to offer coffee of a higher quality to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and will thereby better his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to achieve adequate maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 62 years old and widow with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 53 years old and married with four children. Visitacion works very hard to provide for them.

Visitacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Visitacion has been in this business for 26 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Visitacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Shinan's Group

texts.en: Shinan’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Shinan makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en: Sokchea’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokchea makes a living cultivating rice and finding fishes to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is single, with one child and has a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya is a 19-year-old, single Palestinian refugee. She lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp, to earn her living and to cover her university expenses. She has been working as a tutor from her parents' house since 2014, and she is working on developing her business. For this reason, Aya is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary teaching tools and visual aids, which will help her students to understand with ease the lessons she provides. Aya is very optimistic about this loan, and looks forward to developing her business as much as she can and spreading education among children in the camp.

loans.use: to buy necessary teaching tools and visual aids, which will help her students to understand with ease the lessons she provides.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson has been doing well in his businesses and has successfully service his previous loan.

He has been able to expand his shop thereby gaining more profit. He is requesting for a bigger loan for business expansion. He will use the entire loan amount to buy more stocks of sugar, tea leaves, milk and washing powder for sale.

He hopes to prosper in his businesses in the future and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, tea leaves, milk and washing powder

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 54 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is farming. She has been in this business for 14 years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of seeds and fertilizers.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her last born child and also boost her business. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilber Jose

texts.es:
Wilber es un hombre de treinta y un años de edad, que le gusta mucho ser estilista masculino, él tiene un negocio de barbería, donde corta cabello, delinea barbas y otros servicios del cuidado personal que ocupan los hombres. Poco a poco ha logrado cambiar de local a uno más céntrico y captar más y nueva clientela.
En estos momentos, que su negocio está en pleno crecimiento el necesita comprar otra silla de barbería y con esto contratar a otro barbero que le ayude con tantos clientes, es por eso que ha recurrido a kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita cumplir con esto.  En un futuro desea comprar su propio local para poner su barbería.
texts.en:
Wilber is a 31 year old man who really likes being a male hair stylist. He has a barber shop where he cuts hair, trims beards and provides other personal care services for men. Little by little he has been able to move his locale to a more central location, and attract more and new customers.

Currently with his business in full growth mode, he needs to buy another barber chair and hire another barber to help him with so many customers. That's why he's turned to Kiva with MiCrédito, to obtain a loan to allow him to accomplish this. In the future he hopes to buy a locale in which to put his barber business.

loans.use: to buy another barber chair.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Heman

texts.en:
Despite the low paddy prices, Heman will continue to plant rice. He repaid his last loan on time.

Heman thanks all of his Kiva lenders for their help and again requires a loan of SRD 12,000 so that he can purchase fertilizers and pesticides to continue his rice cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer inputs and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.name: Esiteli

texts.en:
Esiteli is married and has four children, and she lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a restaurant, where she cooks and sells food to local people in her area. This is her major economic activity, which she started six years ago, according to her statement about the profits she has earned. She is hard-working and plans to expand the business, but she faces hardships of competition and dishonest customers not paying cash, which in turn affects her profits.

Esiteli has requested a loan. She will use it to buy more foodstuffs and kitchen utensils for her restaurant business, like rice, maize flour, and big saucepans. These will enable her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and kitchen utensils for her restaurant business, like rice, maize flour, and big saucepans. These will enable her to serve her customers better.

loans.name: Whitney Jasuhara

texts.es:
Withney es conocida por sus compañeros como una joven bastante activa y con una visión clara de lo que desea para su futuro. Su cabellera naranja es una muestra de la seguridad que posee esta estudiante de Comunicación Social de  22 años de edad. Ella está a punto de finalizar su licenciatura, por lo que quiere estar más que preparada para salir con las mejores notas de su generación. 
Por esta razón, Whitney solicita un préstamo para comprar una cámara profesional que le servirá para elaborar un documental como proyecto final para graduarse. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien vende cosméticos y ropa, y de su padre, quien posee una vulcanización. En sus planes está terminar su carrera con honores.
texts.en:
Withney is known by her friends as a very active young woman with a clear vision for her future. Her orange hair is a sign of her self confidence as a 22 year old student social communications. She's very close to finishing her degree and she wants to be ready to be the best in her class.
For this reason, Withney is requesting a loan to buy a professional camera that will help her produce a documentary for her final project for graduation. Fortunately, she has the support of her mother who sells cosmetics and clothes and her father who has a workshop of vulcanization. She wants to finish her degree with high honors.

loans.use: buy a professional camera.

loans.name: Johaana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Johaana es una mujer de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad, muy esforzada y trabajadora, ella tiene su negocio de pulpería. Es una clienta con trayectoria en MiCrédito, también ha tenido otros prestamos por parte de Kiva, con los cuales ha logrado salir adelante y crecer notablemente. Con las ganancias que le genero su último financiamiento logro construir su casa. 
Ella ha vuelto a recurrir a Kiva y MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un financiamiento que le permita invertir en un nuevo negocio, solicita el credito para comprar calzado de diferentes tipos. Ella ha descubierto que este negocio puede ser muy factible dada la demanda que ha tenido en su comunidad. Está claro que Johaana es una mujer con muchas metas y sueños, poco a poco con su buena energía les iras cumpliendo.
texts.en:
Johaana is 41 years old. She is very energetic and hardworking. She has a small grocery store. She is an experienced client of MiCrédito. She also has had other loans from Kiva, which have allowed her to move ahead and grow considerably. With the earnings generated from her last loan she was able to construct her house.

She has returned to Kiva and MiCrédito to obtain financing to allow her to invest in a new business. She seeks a loan to buy different types of footwear. She has discovered that this business can be very feasible given the demand that there is in her community. It is clear that Johanna is a woman with many goals and dreams. Little by little, with her good energy, she will accomplish them.

loans.use: to buy different types of footwear.

loans.name: Nyame Ye Kese Paa Group

texts.en:
Hannah is 37 years of age. She is from Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. Hannah is the group representative of “Nyame Ye Kese Paa”. She is married with two children and their ages are seven and nine years.

Hannah is a food vendor, who sells all dishes both local and continental at her restaurant. She has ten years' working experience. Hannah has three employees who work for her.

Hannah is also a civil servant, who works hard to complement her income source with the restaurant business. Her husband is a businessman who deals in sanitary products to support her in the business.

Hannah's main challenge is the need for working capital to finance the working capital needs of her small restaurant. Her aim of expanding her business in the next five years can be achieved through reinvesting part of the profit into the business.

Hannah hopes to have increased sales that will also let her do some saving to provide quality education for the children. She thanks all her micro lenders for their kind support in realizing her dream.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for the preparation of local and continental dishes, as well as soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 25 years old. She is married and has one child. Her business is operating a boutique and farming. She has been in this business for 7 years. She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy business stock of skirts, shirts, jackets, trousers and jumpers for the boutique. She will use the profits from expanded business to boost her business to make it grow faster. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy business stock of skirts, shirts, jackets, trousers and jumpers for the boutique.

loans.name: Tweimukye Buhungiro Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, aged 38, is a mother of three children who live in Kagadi, Uganda.

Elizabeth operates a produce business selling maize and groundnuts as her major source of income. She started business in 2009 so as to earn a living. She supplements her business with farming.

Elizabeth needs money to add more stock of maize and groundnuts to her business. She has plans of buying land in the future, and her major challenge is that of defaulting customers.

Elizabeth is a member of Tweimukye Buhungiro Group where members guarantee each other to get a loan as they don't offer securities.

loans.use: to add stock of maize and groundnuts in her business

loans.name: Ngombe

texts.en:
Ngombe is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher  shop business for the past three years, selling household  goat meat. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi  married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food .

For the past two years, she has operated a timber selling business from home, selling to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality as a major challenge to her business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase timber for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Gieya April

texts.en:
Gieya April is 21 years old and single with one child. Gieya April works very hard to provide for them.

Gieya April runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell like biscuits, breads canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks and other personal care products.

Gieya April has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell like biscuits, breads canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Alegria

texts.en:
Alegria is a married woman, 62 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alegria has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Alegria requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell like squash, eggplant, sweet potato, beans, spices and etc.

Alegria has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell like squash, eggplant, sweet potato, beans, spices and etc

loans.name: Musenya

texts.en:
Musenya is a married mother of two children, all of whom do not attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is household consumables.

For over eight years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business. She also plans to start another business of poultry selling.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour,beans ,rice and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Gulistan

texts.ru: Гулистан, 54 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 1986 года занимаетсяя разведением скота и полеводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, на 0,32 Га земли выращивает кукурузу. Гулистан хочет развить свое хозяйство, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Гулистан планирует вкладывать в развитие своего бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en:
Gulistan is 54, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education.  She has been raising livestock and growing crops since 1986.  She currently has two cows and 10 sheep and she also grows corn on 0.32 hectares of land.  

Gulistan wants to expand her farming activity.  For this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Mr. Joseph, has always been Nakasero branch client for more than 4 years now. He pays well his previous loan and this time he tends to use the loan offered to him to buy a second motor cycle that will help him increase on his earnings. He is married with 4 children and his now building his own residence at Mukono district.
He appreciates the support rendered to him by the UGAFODE and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy another motor cycle to increase on his incomes

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a trajinera rower in Xochimilco. Trajineras are those beautiful rafts with flowers decorating their front arch, generally named after women that float along a river in the outskirts of Mexico City. Eduardo loves his job and the exposure he has with all the tourists that visit this magic place. He feels lucky he can work in such a beautiful surrounding and also lucky that his job has given him the opportunity to save for many years and build a home for his family.

Now, he is asking for a credit to finish the bathroom. Currently they have to use the neighbors´bathroom if they want to have a shower. He is sure this improvement will benefit enormously all the members of his family and give them more privacy and a healthier lifestyle. Eduardo is thankful for this opportunity and for receiving, along with this credit the visit of a certified technician that will ensure that the bathroom meets all the safety and quality standards once it is finished.

loans.use: to provide a better life for his family by completing the only bathroom in the house

loans.name: Heak's Group

texts.en: Heak’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Heak makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Speu province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Yan Fredy

texts.en:
Yan Fredy is an artisan from Peru who specializes in handcrafted silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones for his jewelry designs.

Yan Fredy has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My father designs and crafts jewelry, and he taught me to love the art of silver. I always loved being in his workshop with him. The old, with its infinite forms, icons and the techniques used by our ancestors…these are very interesting and special, due to our country's history and what this means for us Peruvians. The new has the versatility and perfect craftsmanship of a piece of jewelry. We must always seek innovation."

"I am very grateful for the opportunity that this microcredit provides. It will allow me to be fully prepared for the increase in sales during the upcoming holiday season. Many thanks!"

Use the link below to view Yan Fredy's handcrafted silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8369

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones for his jewelry designs

loans.name: Suyen Carolina

texts.es:
Suyen es una joven estudiante, que tiene muchos sueños y anhelos, ella está en su último año de la carrera de odontología, desde hace unos meses atrás labora en dos clínicas como trabajo de medio tiempo. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres ha logrado dedicarse a estudiar mucho, para convertirse en una buena profesional de la salud bucal. Desde pequeña sintió en ella pasión por ser dentista y ahora esta persiguiendo su sueño. 
Ha recurrido un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, para poder establecer en su casa de habitación una pequeña clínica, dado que ella es muy emprendedora y además pretende ayudar también a otros compañeros dentistas. En futuro desea especializarse en cirugía dental, estudiar fuera y luego regresar para poder establecerse como una de las mejores dentistas de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Suyen is a young student who has many dreams and desire. She's in her last year of odontology. She's been working for the last few months in 2 clinics part time. Thanks to the support of her parents she has dedicated herself to her studies to become a health professional in the area of dentistry. Since she was very small she had a passion for dentistry and now she is pursuing her dream.
She's requesting a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to set up a small clinic in a room in her house. She's very entrepreneurial and she also wants to help her fellow dentists. In the future she wants to specialize in dental surgery, study abroad to then return and establish herself as a premier dental specialist in the city.

loans.use: to set up a clinic in a room in her house.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lanie is 42 years old and has one child still in school.

Lanie has a direct selling business in the Philippines. Lanie requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy perfume, body lotion, deodorant, beauty soap and other personal care products for my business.

Lanie has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume, body lotion, deodorant, beauty soap and other personal care products for my business

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Мохира. Мохира в больнице работает уборщицей. Кроме своей работы, она дома занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды на заказ. Мохира добрая и шустрая женщина, которая хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду несколько лет назад. Мохира в этом году исполнилось 38 лет. Она проживает в городе Душанбе вместе с мужем и 5 детьми. Ее муж работает инженером в водоканале.  В швейном деле Мохире нравится ежедневный доход. Мохира вместе мужем решили, построит дом. Они построили дом, но не до   конца. Им надо сделать штукатурку и приобрести стройматериалы для завершения ремонта.  Из-за нехватки денежных средств Мохира обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку. Ваша поддержка очень нужно Мохире.
texts.en:
Meet Mohira.  Mohira works as a cleaning lady in a hospital.  In addition to her job, she is also an independent seamstress and she sews traditional Tajik dresses from her home.  She is a kind and smart woman who works very well.  She learned how to design and sew clothes a few years ago.  Mohira just turned 38.  She lives in the city of Dushanbe with her husband and her five children.  Her husband is an engineer currently working on a water canal.  Mohira enjoys the daily income that she makes thanks to her sewing activity.

Mohira and her husband have decided to build a house.  Their house is almost complete, but not entirely finished.  They still need to plaster the walls and to buy various construction supplies to finish all construction.  Mohira has requested a loan because she doesn't have enough personal resources.  She hopes that you will support her; your help means a lot to her.

loans.use: to buy cement and other construction materials.

loans.name: Lenny Rodolfo

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Lenny, muestra lo feliz que se siente de dar un paso adelante en cuanto a su buena higiene, puesto que este operador de pozo de 29 años de edad, padre de un pequeño de un año, piensa invertir en el saneamiento de su hogar.
Para poder poseer una mejor higiene, que guarde de enfermedades a su hijo, a su esposa y a él, Lenny solicita un préstamo para construir un sistema de drenaje de aguas negras. Esto le permitirá cumplir con su meta de proteger a su familia. En sus planes también está construir una casa propia, pues actualmente vive donde su mamá.
texts.en:
Lenny's smile shows how happy he is to take a step forward in terms of the good hygiene of his home. He's a well operator of 29 years of age and the father of a one year old son. He wants to invest in the sanitation of his home.
To have a better hygiene to keep his wife, child, and himself free of any diseases, Lenny is requesting a loan to build a waste water drainage system. This will enable him to achieve his goal of protecting his family. Part of his plans is to build his own home since he still lives with his mother.

loans.use: build a waste water drainage system.

loans.name: Uulkelsin

texts.ru: Уулкелсин, 23 года, не замужем, детей нет, живет с мамой, она очень жизнерадостная, любит красивое благоустройство дома, для себя выращивает цветы. У Уулкелсин - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Уулкелсин занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 3 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду Уулкелсин, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, лошадь и 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уулкелсин обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Уулкелсин планирует вложить в развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Uulkelsin is 23 and single with no children. She lives with her mother and is a very cheerful person who loves beautiful home landscaping and to grow flowers for herself. She has a higher education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as a primary source of income for her family, a business she started three years ago. Thanks to her hard work she currently has four cows, a horse and 25 sheep on her farm with a monthly income of 13,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Uulkelsin has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz marina es un mujer emprendedora, que desde hace 30 años da lo mejor de ella para salir adelante con sus hijos. Anteriormente ella había solicitado un préstamo para la remodelación de un inodoro, que le permitió que mejorar la calidad de salud que tenía.
Ahora está mujer de 54 años de edad, solicita un nuevo préstamo de saneamiento, con el cual va a comprar bomba, palanca y otros materiales para reparar un inodoro que está dañado. Esto le servirá a seguir dando un servicio de calidad a la casa que alquila. Al cancelar pretende remodelar un cuarto de las casas que alquila.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is an entrepreneurial woman who has been doing her best to get ahead her children for 30 years. She had previously requested a loan to remodel a toilet which helped her improve her health quality.
Now this 54 year old woman is requesting a new loan for sanitation purposes with which she will buy a pump, lever, and other materials to repair a damaged toilet. This will help her continue giving a service of quality to the house she rents. Once paid off she wishes to remodel a room in one of the houses she rents.

loans.use: buy a pump, lever, and other materials.

loans.name: Lourdes Vanesa

texts.es:
Lourdes requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, gas propano, bebidas, harina, etc., para tener materia prima para la venta de antojitos y pupusas, los créditos le permiten adquirir todo lo necesario al por mayor y a un bajo costo.
Ella está satisfecha por haber aprendido a administrar los créditos que se le otorgan en Padecomsm, pues mantiene la continuidad de la venta de antojitos y también pudo cultivar maíz, su negocio es más rentable ya que ha reactivado la venta de ropa y compro una vaca para tener producción de leche y así alimentar mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Lourdes requires more funding to buy oil, cheese, pork rinds, propane gas, drinks, flour, etc, to have the basic ingredients to sell snacks and stuffed tortillas. The loans will allow her to obtain all that is necessary, at low wholesale costs.

She is happy to have learned about the loans awarded through Padecomsm, so she can continue to sell snacks as well as be able to harvest corn. Her business is very profitable since she has started selling clothing again, and bought a cow to produce milk. Thus, she provides better for her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, cheese, pork rinds, propane gas, drinks, flour, etc, to have the main ingredients to sell snacks and stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
José, es un joven hombre de treinta y dos años de edad, la vida le ha enseñado el valor del trabajo, él se esfuerza día a día para salir adelante y ser mejor, se dedica a ser productor agropecuario y comerciante, en su pequeña finca cosecha maíz y frijoles, también tiene ganado bovino. Alterna los días de la semana para dedicarlos a su finca y salir a vender productos a otros pueblos. El ya había sido beneficiado con un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, con el cual logro crecer y obtener ganancias que le permitieron mejorar su casa de habitación. 
Él ha solicitado un financiamiento que le permita comprar un toro de raza, para hacer crecer su ganado bovino y dedicarse a la producción de productos derivados de la leche, así mismo a la venta de carne de res. Este hombre confía plenamente en Kiva y MiCrédito, planea seguir trabajando con financiamientos hasta que sus negocios ya no lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man of 32 years of age. Life has taught him the value of hard work. He strives everyday to get ahead and be better. He works as a farmer and merchant. In his small farm he grows corn and beans and also has cattle. He alternates during the week working on his farm and traveling to other nearby towns to sell his products.
He had already been the beneficiary of a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito with which he was able to grow and obtain more income allowing him to improve his home. He's requesting a loan that will help him buy a purebred bull so he can grow his cattle operation and dedicate himself to producing dairy products as well as beef.
This man trusts Kiva and MiCrédito and plans to keep working with loans until his businesses no longer need them.

loans.use: purebred bull.

loans.name: Reina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Reina, es una persona dedica a la sastrería, vive con sus hijos, los cuales ha sacado adelante con mucho sacrificio, tiene aproximadamente 8 años de tener su negocio, es muy reconocida en la zona por su honestidad y calidad de trabajo que realiza.
Está necesitando de un crédito para comprar broches, telas, blondas, agujas, hilos y otros materiales básicos para mantenerse trabajando en la sastrería, espera que la inversión le facilite atender mejor a sus clientes y tener más ganancias para pagar sus deudas.
Las aspiraciones de Reina son ser una persona de ejemplo en la sociedad por luchar por superarse y ayudar a sus hijos hacerlo.
texts.en:
Reina works as a seamstress. She lives with her children whom she's been able to get ahead with a lot of sacrifice. She's had her business for approximately 8 years and is very well recognized in the area for her honesty and for the quality of her work.
She needs a credit to buy brooches, fabric, lace, needles, thread, and other basic materials to continue working as a seamstress. She hopes that her investment will help her to take better care of her clients and have better earnings so she can pay her debts.
Reina's goals are to be an exemplary person in society which is why she fights to get ahead and wants to help her children achieve better things.

loans.use: buy brooches, fabric, lace, needles, thread, and other basic materials to continue working as a seamstress.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise is a strong woman who has overcome many challenges with unwavering optimism and positivity. She has worked full time as an English and reading teacher for over 20 years, and she hopes to continue teaching for as long as possible. Her work has always been her passion as she feels strongly about making a difference in other’s lives.

Denise has experienced a long string of hardships that have only made her stronger and more determined! She has rebounded from a major medical crisis that could have taken her life while also coping with the loss of her husband of 20 years. Soon after her recovery, she was faced with having to become the primary caregiver for her ailing mother. She cared for her mother for four years until her passing, and this caused quite a financial strain on Denise due to lost hours at work and medical costs.

Denise has since recovered from these hard times and has consistently been able to cover her living expenses in a timely manner, but the damage to her credit that occurred while caring for her mother has greatly affected her ability to obtain financing to pay for a new roof for her home.

Denise is in desperate need of a new roof as there are major leaks within her home. Because Florida experiences serious thunder storms and is currently in hurricane season, Denise has been very anxious about the possibility of the ceiling caving in on her with heavy rainfall. She is hoping that SELF and Kiva can help her finance a new roof that will greatly improve the safety and security of her home and also repair the extensive water damage that has already occurred and is threatening to further exacerbate the poor condition of her roof.

loans.use: install a new roof that will greatly improve the safety of her home as well as prevent further damage and mold growth that may threaten her health.

loans.name: Rhina Margarita

texts.es:
Rhina, es una mujer emprendedora que se ha esforzado por sostener su hogar, vive en casa propia, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos, dos ya están estudiando en la universidad y el otro a nivel de bachillerato, sus ingresos son generados por una tienda de productos primera necesidad y por la venta de pupusas, cuenta además con una pensión a partir del fallecimiento de su esposo, atiende su negocio de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche, lo tiene desde hace 22 años, está ubicado frente al parque de la comunidad donde vive.
El crédito le será de utilidad para ahorrar en la compra de granos básicos, azúcar, sal, bebidas, galletas, huevos, quesillo, etc., al mayoreo para fortalecer la tienda y elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera que sus ganancias sean mayores.
Los objetivos de Rhina son tener un negocio más competitivo y ayudar a su familia para que tengan una mejor vida y sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rhina is an enterprising woman who has made every effort to support her home. She lives in her home, is a widow and has three childen. Two children are already studying in college and the other in high school.

Rhina's income is generated through a store sellilng products of everyday need and through the sale of pupusas. She is also able to count on a pension since the death of her husband.
Rhina runs her business from 6AM until 8PM, and has had it for 22 years. The store is located in the park of the community where she lives.

The loan will be useful to her in saving on the wholesale purchase of basic grains, sugar, salt, soft drinks, crackers, eggs, cheese, etc., in order to strengthen her store's offerings and to make papusas. Rhina's purposes are to have a more competitive business and to help her family so they can have a better life and her children con complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, salt, soft drinks, crackers, eggs, cheese, etc. wholesale in order to strengthen her store's offerings and make papusas.

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
Jose tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Colasay que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 5 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Jose espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old and lives with his wife and their children in a house they own, made of rustic materials. They live in Colasay district, which is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Life in this district is calm, and most of the residents earn their living through agriculture, commerce, and farming.

Jose is a farmer. More specifically, he cultivates coffee. He has been doing this work for 5 years, and has very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan he will receive will be used to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can correctly maintain his coffee crop, and to hire laborers to help out at harvest time. In this way, Jose hopes to offer better quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his level of income and thus improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can correctly maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un hombre de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, que ama la vida en el campo, el es productor agropecuario, en su finca siembra maíz y frijoles, además tiene vacas de las cuales elabora queso, cuajadas, leche, leche agria, entre otros productos derivados. Él ya había sido beneficiado con un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, con el cual logro adquirir más ganado. 
Ha vuelto a recurrir a un financiamiento, esta vez para destinarlo a la compra de comida para las vacas, desparasitantes, vitaminas, alambres púas y madera para reforzar el corral. El planea seguir trabajando con Kiva junto MiCrédito, porque valora las grandes oportunidades que se le han brindado a partir de estos. En un futuro desea comprar más ganado y carro en el cual movilizarse.
texts.en:
José is a 48 year old man who loves life and the land. He is the agricultural producer on his farm, which sows corn and beans, and he also has cows, from which he makes cheese, cottage cheese, milk, cuajada [fermented cow's milk eaten with bread or tortilla for breakfast], and other dairy products. He has already benefited from a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito, with which he managed to generate more income.

He has returned to request another loan, this time to buy cow food, deworming medications, vitamins, wire spikes, and wood to reinforce the corral. He plans to continue working with Kiva and MiCrédito, because he values the great opportunities that they have provided him. In the future, he wants to buy more cattle and a car to move them in.

loans.use: to buy food for cows, deworming medications, vitamins, wire spikes, and wood to reinforce the corral.

loans.name: Jim Antonio

texts.es:
Jim es un hombre trabajador, que ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, laborando para salir adelante junto con su familia, su esposa y un hijo de seis años de edad. Él es Licenciado en Administración de empresa, título que le ha ayudado a encaminarse a un buen puesto laboral como cobrador en una institución. 
A sus 36 años de edad, lo más importante para Jim es su familia, por lo que decidió realizar un préstamo para comprar láminas de zinc, una puerta, tablas, clavos y mano de obra para terminar de construir su baño, de manera que él y su familia puedan tener un sanitario y una ducha más digna. En sus otras metas está construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Jim is a man who works hard, and who has spent most of his life working to support himself and his family, his wife and a son who is six years old. 

He has a university degree in business administration, a qualification that has helped him move up to a good job as a bill collector in a company. 

At 36 years of age, the most important thing for Jim is his family, so he decided to request a loan to buy sheets of zinc, a door, boards, and nails and to pay labor costs to finish building the bathroom, so he and his family can have a decent shower and toilet. 

Among his other goals is building his own home.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc, a door, boards, and nails and to pay labor costs to finish building the bathroom.

loans.name: Zisung - Nyong-Guma Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is a 47-year-old hardworking woman living in Nyong-Guma in the northern region of Ghana. She is married and has six children. Memunatu is the individual seated in the middle with the hand raised in the photo.

Memunatu is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for more than three years now. The name of the group is ‘Zisung - Nyong-Guma’. Memunatu’s group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and international markets. This has consequently increased demand for their shea products.

Memunatu and ‘Zisung - Nyong-Guma’ have asked for another loan of GHS 16,600 after having paid off a previous loan of GHC 15,500 for which they thank their Kiva lenders. Memunatu’s share of the loan is GHC 600.00 which she would use to buy more shea nuts for processing.

Memunatu wishes to earn more income to pay back this loan and support her children’s health and educational needs. Memunatu and the group thank Kiva lenders for their continual support.

loans.use: to buy more shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Agua Buena Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AGUA BUENA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Timotea ella es soltera y tiene 52 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanias, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de pasto.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners are part of the community bank "Agua Buena". This bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.
The highlighted partner for the loan is Mrs. Timotea who is 52 years of age and single. The partner works in a convenience store selling articles like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00AM to 7:00PM. The partner is a very entrepreneurial and hard working woman who through this small business has been able to get ahead her family. She's had this business for 5 years already and things are going very well. Her dream is to expand her convenience store.
The partner is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She's attached to the group picture because the picture was taken after the meeting and she had asked for permission to leave early due to work obligations.
The other members of the group work selling handicrafts, clothes, have a convenience store and sell hay. The partner is grateful of those that take part of her dream through helping in this way and she's committed to make all payments on time.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Maritza Antonia

texts.es:
Todos los días Maritza, inicia su jornada laboral desde muy temprano, empieza a echar tortillas para que los clientes de su comunidad se comiencen a agrupar afuera de su casa para comprarlas. Luego todas las tardes comienza a preparar la carne, pollo y cerdo que vende por la noche. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada, que desde hace veinte tres años se dedica a tener estos dos negocios, con los cuales ha logrado sacar a sus dos hijos adelante. 
En estos momentos, ella ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, para que se le brinde la oportunidad de mejorar la infraestructura de su local, para poder comprar mesas para que sus clientes esperen cómodos y hacer captar a nuevos compradores de su producto. En un futuro desea tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Every morning, Maritza starts her workday very early. She starts making tortillas so that her clients in the community will start to gather in front of her house to buy them.

Later, every afternoon, she begins to prepare the beef, chicken, and pork she sells in the evening.

She is a very hardworking woman, who for twenty three years has done these two jobs that have allowed her to make a living and support her two children.

Currently, she has requested a Kiva Micredito loan that will give her the opportunity to improve the infrastructure of her business. She will buy tables so that her customers can wait comfortably, which will also attract new buyers for her products.

In the future she hopes to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables.

loans.name: Maura Cristina

texts.en:
Maura Cristina lives with her family in a house that, together with her husband, she has been able to build. Much needs to be done so that it covers all the family needs. However, Maura sees this credit and relation with Kiva as a unique opportunity to advance in the completion of the house. She is determined to be a good payer so that she can access a new credit as soon as this one is paid off.

Maura wants to use this credit to finish covering the water and electricity installations that are still exposed around the house. She feels unsafe with tubes and wires, especially when her son Oscar (shown in picture) is running around. She will receive technical supervision from certified technicians to ensure the work is done correctly. Maura says that with this credit she will be able to make some work that otherwise would take her almost two years to complete, and for that she is thankful.

loans.use: to provide a safer environment for her family
